1.name: Stellar Jade
1.story_desc: A fleeting gleam arrowing across the night sky. Catch it before it's gone. Maybe it can be used to barter? "Some say that the lights are wishes of sentient beings. While insignificant and elusive, they did light up the pocket of sky around them, right?"

2.name: Credit
2.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
2.story_desc: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

3.name: Oneiric Shard
3.story_desc: Crystallized lights floating in the sea of stars, pulsing with the residual dream of an ancient Leviathan. Everything of the old world turned in the end into candlelight that illuminates the darkness ahead.

11.name: Trailblaze Power
11.desc:
Trailblaze Power will constantly regenerate at a rate of 1 point every 6 minutes to a max of 240 points. You may exchange Stellar Jade for Trailblaze Power.
When Trailblaze Power has been fully regenerated or exceeds the maximum accumulation amount, it will no longer regenerate. At the same time, Reserved Trailblaze Power will begin to regenerate over time.
11.story_desc: The Imaginary power residing in the engines of the Astral Express that protects travelers on the Path of Trailblaze. "Explore, understand, establish, and connect — that is what it means to trailblaze. Akivili may have fallen, but their legacy continues!"

12.name: Reserved Trailblaze Power
12.desc:
When Trailblaze Power reaches or exceeds the max limit, Reserved Trailblaze Power will begin to regenerate over time. Reserved Trailblaze Power recovers 1 point every 18 minutes for a max of 2400 points.
Reserved Trailblaze Power can withdraw an equivalent amount of Trailblaze Power for a max of 240 points each time.
12.story_desc: Reserve resources for the Express that functions as a reliable safeguard for the trailblazing expedition. "Resource reserves. Hmm, do we have reserves of reserves? Such was {NICKNAME}'s question."

21.name: EXP
21.desc: The depths of memory, proof of growth.
21.story_desc: "I am not Fuli... I only believe in myself, for the path of immortality never ends."

22.name: Trailblaze EXP
22.desc: A measure of your Trailblaze Progress. Accumulate Trailblaze EXP to increase Trailblaze Level.

24.name: Trailblaze Timer
24.desc: Permanently increase max Technique Points by 1.
24.story_desc: The Relic of a Nameless. An item that might have been a pocket watch or a compass. It is said that the first part to break was the chain. It suddenly snapped during a warp jump, the links scattering everywhere. Then, it was the back. Hit by a lead bullet, it was on the verge of falling apart. Lastly, it was the markings on the face. They were gradually worn flat over the long years, becoming no longer visible. It broke countless times and underwent endless repairs. Its former shape was no longer discernible, and only the stilled sharp hands were pointing ever forward. Take it, Legwork. It's yours now... Then, continue onward...

25.name: The Returning Trail
25.desc: Traces from a past journey. Accumulate this to progress on the Path of Return.
25.story_desc: Tracks left behind by the Nameless. Follow its guidance to find your way back to Trailblaze's star rail.

31.name: Cosmic Fragment
31.desc: A unique currency obtained through exploring Simulated Universe. Will be cleared after Simulated Universe is restarted.
31.story_desc: File fragments generated when the Simulated Universe is running. When they pile up, the performance of Simulated Universe will be significantly affected. "Sort them regularly. In return, the admin can perhaps change your stats every now and then."

32.name: Ability Point
32.desc: Indescribable materials used to unlock abilities in the Simulated Universe.
32.story_desc: A number you can accumulate or spend to strengthen Support systems in the Simulated Universe. "It even took Screwllum two system hours to develop an anti-cheat module."

33.name: Immersifier
33.desc: This item can be exchanged by spending 40 Trailblaze Power, and is used to exchange for Immersion Rewards in the Simulated Universe
33.story_desc: This digitized Trailblaze Power can only be used in the Simulated Universe. "Explore, understand, establish, and connect — that is what it means to trailblaze. Akivili may have fallen, but their legacy continues!"

41.name: Achievement Points
41.desc: Every step of your journey leads to something bigger.
41.story_desc: "The definition of success is broader than conquering a formidable foe or touching the stars. Success is every time you achieve something you've never done before."

51.name: The Nameless EXP
51.desc: Used to increase Nameless Honor levels.
51.story_desc: Accept the gifts of those who came before and begin your own trailblazing expedition. "Experience often comes at a cost, but that is why they are irreplaceable."

52.name: The Nameless EXP
52.desc: Used to increase Nameless Honor levels.
52.story_desc: Accept the gifts of those who came before and begin your own trailblazing expedition. "Experience often comes at a cost, but that is why they are irreplaceable."

53.name: Development Fund
53.desc: The museum development fund issued by the Architects.
53.story_desc: As the museum continues to revitalize and improve, the Architects will issue a development budget for upgrading and recruiting staff, so that {NICKNAME} can better manage the various exhibit halls.

101.name: Star Rail Pass
101.story_desc: Astral Express Universal Pass. Travel as far as the Star Rail stretches. "Map worlds, meet people, make memories."

102.name: Star Rail Special Pass
102.story_desc: Direct ticket for the Astral Express with coordinates of specific worlds, suitable for passengers who just want to go from point A to point B. "Need to catch up with an old friend? Hop on and see the universe with him/her/it/them!"

201.name: Fuel
201.desc: Item used to replenish Trailblaze Power. Provides 60 Trailblaze Power.
201.story_desc: Fuel canisters filled up with the dreams and courage of the Nameless. "Idealism? I prefer to call it the observer effect and human self-actualization."

211.name: Travel Encounters
211.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides 1000 Character EXP.
211.story_desc: A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you. "Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

212.name: Adventure Log
212.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides 5000 Character EXP.
212.story_desc: A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques. "Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient." "Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

213.name: Traveler's Guide
213.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides 20,000 Character EXP.
213.story_desc: Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered. "All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase." "For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

221.name: Sparse Aether
221.desc: Enhancement material for Light Cones, provides 500 Light Cone EXP.
221.story_desc: An imaginary substance that shouldn't exist in reality. The basic material to create Light Cones. The images contained in the Light Cones become clearer when infused with this substance. "I see, so this is the supposed 'memoria' of the Garden of Recollection. No wonder the Memokeepers can set off on galactic voyages with memories."

222.name: Condensed Aether
222.desc: Enhancement material for Light Cones, provides 2000 Light Cone EXP.
222.story_desc: A can of Aether refined through special techniques. "Handle with care, do not drop or place pressure upon it. If damages and leaks occur, please refer to chapter II of the Leak Disaster Response Manual for emergency response."

223.name: Refined Aether
223.desc: Enhancement material for Light Cones, provides 6000 Light Cone EXP.
223.story_desc: A canister of aether that has been extracted and distilled using special procedures. "The Garden looks forward to recreating a past glory, but it is a 'past glory' selected by them. Do you understand?"

231.name: Lost Lightdust
231.desc: Enhancement material for Relics. Provides 100 Relic EXP.
231.story_desc: Lightdust permeated the Fragmentum, carrying what seems to indicate the existence of another civilization. "Theosophy holds that the database used to store information of the material world is called the Akasha Records. I don't necessarily support this, but... these dust indeed store information from the past. They are like... seeds? When you water them, they can yield bountiful fruit."

232.name: Lost Gold Fragment
232.desc: Enhancement material for Relics. Provides 500 Relic EXP.
232.story_desc: Carefully collected Fragmentum dust with irregular shapes. Under the right conditions, they can express specific forms of relics. When the stars return to the right position... Ha! Just kidding.

233.name: Lost Crystal
233.desc: Enhancement material for Relics. Provides 1000 Relic EXP.
233.story_desc: A Fragmentum dust crystal that had densified after being reduced to its original form. "This must not be placed together with the ores offered to the Amber Lord. This is a creation of the Stellaron and goes against the will of Preservation."

234.name: Lost Essence
234.desc: Enhancement material for Relics. Provides 2000 Relic EXP.
234.story_desc: A large Fragmentum dust crystal that had densified after being reduced to its original form. "It can even recreate our deceased mother if it has enough information! It really can! Even if it was only for 26 seconds... I just have one question after I completed the experiment: Just why was the Fragmentum created?"

235.name: Relic Remains
235.story_desc: Broken parts of a relic that are one step away from decomposing into the Lightdust floating in the Fragmentum. "Don't take them for mere scraps. I can restore them to their original state."

236.name: Self-Modeling Resin
236.desc: Rare material used to custom-make Relics. It can model itself according to expectations.
236.story_desc: This unknown resin is as smooth to the touch as finely-grained dust. It seems to be from the Fragmentum, and has been shaped into the form of a wish by an invisible hand. "Based on the Guild's research, the Self-Modeling Resin may be the basis of the Fragmentum's capacity to replicate entities..."

241.name: Tracks of Destiny
241.story_desc: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

251.name: Undying Embers
251.story_desc: Sighing embers formed when a shooting star fell from the sky. "At least they were once hot and bright."

252.name: Undying Starlight
252.story_desc: Splendid gems formed when a shooting star fell from the sky. "Precious things stay precious."

261.name: Lucent Afterglow
261.desc: Used to exchange for rewards at the Light Cone Manifest shop.
261.story_desc: An afterimage of bygone days, invaluable to the Garden of Recollection. The Garden of Recollection has its own rules: Exchange time for time and memory for memory. The Garden of Recollection can even bring back to you a lost, irrevocable past for the right cost...

262.name: Jade Feather
262.desc: Used to exchange for rewards at the Jokes Come True shop.
262.story_desc: In 2104 AE, Fomenko — a Candelagraphos scribe — obtained a mute parrot. She took great care of it, but it still only lived less than a decade. To commemorate her mute friend, Fomenko made quills out of the ten outermost feathers of the parrot's wings. One of these was for herself, while the other nine were stored in a vault. She used her quills to annotate for an entire Amber Era, preserving vast swathes of ancient documents on the verge of being lost. At her funeral, her peers and students burst into tears because "a lamp that illuminated our cosmic past had been snuffed out." It wasn't until people went over Fomenko's legacy that they finally realized that the scribe had been writing nothing but lies with her quills. "Since the beginning of human history, the birds have been observing all the glory, folly, and glorious and foolish things humans have accomplished. The birds know. The birds take part. The birds remain silent."

271.name: Superimposer (Custom-made)
271.desc: A special gadget made by Herta. It can Superimpose special Light Cones obtained from the Simulated Universe.
271.story_desc: A special gadget made by Herta. Its principles are not stated. "Be grateful, {NICKNAME}. I've prepared everything for you."

503.name: Herta Bond
503.desc: A reward from the Simulated Universe. Can be used to buy items from Herta's Store.

800.name: First Voyage's Blessing
800.desc: Use to gain 60 Trailblaze Power and a 1:1 replica.
800.story_desc:
A blessing offered to those starting their journey.

May you embrace the skies and give the greetings of your first voyage to the endless starry seas.
May you cross the snowstorm and ignite an eternal flame at the end of the frigid winter.
The footsteps you leave behind will one day become a road upon which stars would shine.

801.name: First Voyage's Blessing
801.story_desc:
A blessing offered to those starting their journey.

May you embrace the skies and give the greetings of your first voyage to the endless starry seas.
May you cross the snowstorm and ignite an eternal flame at the end of the frigid winter.
The footsteps you leave behind will one day become a road upon which stars would shine.

71000.name: Relic Coffret: Passerby of Wandering Cloud
71000.desc: A device used to collect and restore the Lightdust in the Fragmentum to its original form. Use this to obtain a random 5-star relic from the Passerby of Wandering Cloud set.
71000.story_desc: You never know what's in the box until you open it. "So it's essentially like buying a lottery ticket?" "At least we don't need to worry about finding a cat that is both dead and alive."

89001.name: Planar Ornaments
89001.desc: Artificial relics made by Herta in imitation to the principles behind the Fragmentum. Its data is sourced from the Simulated Universe.
89001.story_desc: Artificial relics made in imitation to the principles behind the Fragmentum. Worlds that exist in theory are stored within spherical Planar Ornaments. "It's like a kind of Relic, but much bigger... and much more condensed."

89002.name: Planar Ornaments
89002.desc: Artificial relics made by Herta in imitation to the principles behind the Fragmentum. Its data is sourced from the Simulated Universe.
89002.story_desc: Artificial relics made in imitation to the principles behind the Fragmentum. Worlds that exist in theory are stored within spherical Planar Ornaments. "It's like a kind of Relic, but much bigger... and much more condensed."

89003.name: Planar Ornaments
89003.desc: Artificial relics made by Herta in imitation to the principles behind the Fragmentum. Its data is sourced from the Simulated Universe.
89003.story_desc: Artificial relics made in imitation to the principles behind the Fragmentum. Worlds that exist in theory are stored within spherical Planar Ornaments. "It's like a kind of Relic, but much bigger... and much more condensed."

89004.name: Planar Ornaments
89004.desc: Artificial relics made by Herta in imitation to the principles behind the Fragmentum. Its data is sourced from the Simulated Universe.
89004.story_desc: Artificial relics made in imitation to the principles behind the Fragmentum. Worlds that exist in theory are stored within spherical Planar Ornaments. "It's like a kind of Relic, but much bigger... and much more condensed."

100000.name: Star of Honor
100000.desc: Virtual goods from Cosmic Warfare. Collect enough of them to receive rewards.

100001.name: Pixel Warhead
100001.desc: Necessary item for Encirclement. Consumes 1 each use and will regenerate over time.

110101.name: Tears of Dreams
110101.desc: Sealed thoughts and feelings. Can substitute Path Materials when they are insufficient. The substitution ratio of Tears of Dreams varies depending on the materials' rarity.
110101.story_desc: The unresolved resentment, the unsolved puzzle, the places never reached, the achievements never attained... All the regrets that make the human soul bend its knees are sealed into these tears condensed by time. "Believe me, everything is possible in dreams..."

110111.name: Shattered Blade
110111.desc: Weapon fragments left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces slightly for Destruction characters.
110111.story_desc: This brand represents their rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction. The master of this weapon rides on a scarlet horse to ignite cities, to take peace from humankind, and to bring down nations akin to anthills. "The bearer of this brand is tasked with driving peace out of nations."

110112.name: Lifeless Blade
110112.desc: Weapon remnants left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces moderately for Destruction characters.
110112.story_desc: This brand represents their rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction. The master of this weapon carries a strong hatred for all sentient beings. They relish in the lament of intelligent beings as sweet melodies and topple civilizations with millennia of history in the blink of an eye. "The bearer of this brand is tasked with stopping breath among the living."

110113.name: Worldbreaker Blade
110113.desc: Broken weapon left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces significantly for Destruction characters.
110113.story_desc: This weapon represents its owner's rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction. The owner of this weapon makes their appearance at the end of a war to fan the embers to consume the world. Regardless of the glories of the past or the blessing of its deities, this planet is destined to return to the ashes it came from, and to wither away in the depths of the starry sky. The bearer of this brand is tasked with purifying the world.

110121.name: Arrow of the Beast Hunter
110121.desc: An arrowhead forged with Frost Steel by the craftsmen of Xianzhou. Used to level up Traces slightly for Hunt characters.
110121.story_desc: A gift that parents give to their children who've successfully hunted their first prey at their coming of age ceremony. It is a blessing that their life would be as successful and true as an arrow heading towards its mark. "May the arrow on your waist and the sword in your sheath stay true and always find its target."

110122.name: Arrow of the Demon Slayer
110122.desc: An arrowhead forged with Stellaris Essence by the craftsmen of Xianzhou. Used to level up Traces moderately for Hunt characters.
110122.story_desc: An arrow narrower than a finger's width. It can be loaded into an electromagnetic crossbow or a thermal seeking bow as ammunition. Its power is enough to penetrate the tough shells of abominations with just one strike. "The celestial banished arrives from afar, great distances journeyed 'twixt oceans of stars. Like rain falls a cloudburst of arrows below, in a helmet reflected the bright lunar glow."

110123.name: Arrow of the Starchaser
110123.desc: A shard of the Sky-Shattering Lux Arrow shot by the Reignbow Arbiter. Used to level up Traces significantly for Hunt characters.
110123.story_desc: The remains of a divine construct that ordinary humans can rarely behold. What kind of force can shatter stars that are light-years away? Humanity can only imagine the power of the Lux Arrow from the ashes it left behind. Only the Furnace Master, chief of the Xianzhou artisans, has the rights to reforge the shards for those who are worthy. "The death of a star shall shine bright for ages to come."

110131.name: Key of Inspiration
110131.desc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the Meditative Scholars. Used to level up Traces slightly for Erudition characters.
110131.story_desc: It can unlock inspirations hidden deep within the conscience. To take hold of the key is to grasp at the darting embers of thought that lead to the forward path. "Eureka!"

110132.name: Key of Knowledge
110132.desc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the sages of the worlds. Used to level up Traces moderately for Erudition characters.
110132.story_desc: It can unlock the mysteries binding the truth of the world and grants knowledge beyond the understanding of humans. No matter how the wielder attempts to display their possession of the key, no one but themselves can see its form. Some people believe that to be a gift from the heavens, while others think it's a sign of mental disorder. "I had a dream of molecules coiling up into a loop like a snake biting its own tail. I woke up realizing that this is the answer I've been looking for all along!"

110133.name: Key of Wisdom
110133.desc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the greatest prodigies of the cosmos. Used to level up Traces significantly for Erudition characters.
110133.story_desc: This is the proof of invitation to the halls of the Nous Temple. Finding the door of which this key opens is a far more arduous task than obtaining the key itself. Those who pass through the doors will immediately realize the impossibility of returning to this side. "The Erudition does not have answers to the universe, but it will teach you how to ask the right questions."

110141.name: Endurance of Bronze
110141.desc: A crude but durable ancient hand-held bronze shield. Used to level up Traces slightly for Preservation characters.
110141.story_desc: Ancient legends entail a war where humans exhausted all primitive methods, following the gods into battle against overwhelmingly powerful beasts. This shield is a witness to that war. "There's no choice but to stop it, even if the efforts are futile."

110142.name: Oath of Steel
110142.desc: A shield forged with irreplaceable craftsmanship from an unknown alloy. Used to level up Traces moderately for Preservation characters.
110142.story_desc: It may be a large shield, but it feels as light as a feather. Even after taking on a full charge, no marks can be seen on the face of the shield. Ancient legends tell of a war where high-spirited warriors wielded deathray-beaming spears and shields forged of Frost Steel, defended a nation destined to falter in the face of war. This shield is a witness to that war. "Powerful voices chant: 'The enemies are at our gates!'"

110143.name: Safeguard of Amber
110143.desc: An unusual shield embedded with ambers mined from beyond the skies. Used to level up Traces significantly for Preservation characters.
110143.story_desc: The wielder of this shield is seemingly protected by an invisible shield wall, immune to fiery arrows or mountainous claws. Ancient legends entail a war where a tribal hero wielding a bronze shield charged to their death against a Leviathan, together with warriors armed with fiery spears. This shield is a witness to that war. "Do not cross the line."

110151.name: Obsidian of Dread
110151.desc: A fragment of dark matter captured from the void. Used to level up Traces slightly for Nihility characters.
110151.story_desc: Nothing can prove its noumenon. Touch gently to hear an unclear murmur from the shard. "████ ██ █ █"

110152.name: Obsidian of Desolation
110152.desc: A chunk of dark matter captured from the void. Used to level up Traces moderately for Nihility characters.
110152.story_desc: No reflections can be seen on the surface of the black prism. Not only does it suck in all the light, it seems to also absorb the wielder's emotions, leaving only a faint feeling of emptiness. "..."

110153.name: Obsidian of Obsession
110153.desc: A sizable piece of dark matter captured from the void. Used to level up Traces significantly for Nihility characters.
110153.story_desc: The weak-minded and soft-willed will spend their eternity in chaos from just a simple glance into the prism. " "

110161.name: Harmonic Tune
110161.desc: A compact music box made by an unknown person. Used to level up Traces slightly for Harmony characters.
110161.story_desc: It plays a relaxing and joyful tune. Even through the simplistic tune, anyone with the slightest understanding of music can tell the mastery of the composer of the piece. "Grab the hands of your Family and let us dance!"

110162.name: Ancestral Hymn
110162.desc: A music box made by an unknown person. Used to level up Traces moderately for Harmony characters.
110162.story_desc: It plays a hymn sung by a small band. It is impossible to find out to whom the lyric of the hymn sends its praise. "Penury, trial of the Great One! Wealth, grace of the Great One!"

110163.name: Stellaris Symphony
110163.desc: A music box with complex structures made by an unknown person. Used to level up Traces significantly for Harmony characters.
110163.story_desc: It plays a powerful cosmic symphony. "Some astronomers believe that the revolutions of the heavenly spheres work the same as complex mechanical structures. The crystal clear and pleasant notes emitted during the movements of the stars are known as the 'Harmony of the Heavenly Spheres.'"

110171.name: Seed of Abundance
110171.desc: A seed of blessing sown by the Aeon of Abundance. Used to level up Traces slightly for Abundance characters.
110171.story_desc: Those who come in contact with it are slowly healed of their wounds and illnesses. People who pray for the blessing of life while in despair will always have their prayers answered. "You shall be granted what you ask for."

110172.name: Sprout of Life
110172.desc: A young sprout emerging from the Seed of Abundance. Used to level up Traces moderately for Abundance characters.
110172.story_desc: Radiating warmth, life and growth flourish around the place where it sinks its roots. Barren wastelands turn into luscious grass fields, withered plants rejuvenate and blossom, and springs burst through the ground to moisten the land. As you get closer to it, your muscles and bones twitch and propagate with an unbearable itch. "Life is unfailing where the soul abounds."

110173.name: Flower of Eternity
110173.desc: A gorgeous flower blooming from the Sprout of Life. Used to level up Traces significantly for Abundance characters.
110173.story_desc: The stamen contains the concentrated power of the Path of Abundance, ensuring the flower's ever-lasting vitality. No fire, ice, or any harshness can hinder the growth of this magnificent life form. Given time, its leaves shall feed upon starlight. Its roots shall burrow into the flesh of every being of this world, all-connected, never-perishing. Its fruits shall fulfill the promise of immortality. "There be giant ships, eclipsing mountains, drifting over the void. Upon them grows the undying tree. Its consumption grants immortality."

110181.name: Borisin Teeth
110181.desc: Broken teeth fragments left behind during the borisins' conquests. Used to level up Traces slightly for Destruction characters.
110181.story_desc: Borisins consider their teeth as a warrior's blade and weapon. The Borisin worship warriors possessing supreme power. In their tribes, where the strong rule the weak, those with dental caries will only be discarded by the group. "O, Brood Lord, grant us sharp teeth and claws."

110182.name: Lupitoxin Sawteeth
110182.desc: Blood-sucking sharp fangs left behind during the borisins' conquests. Used to level up Traces moderately for Destruction characters.
110182.story_desc: Borisins consider their teeth as a warrior's blade and weapon. A maddening impulse flows through the Borison blood. Fueled by Lupitoxin, they rend their enemies with their sawteeth and suck their blood, and are undefeated. "O, Brood Lord, grant us steel skin and bones."

110183.name: Moon Madness Fang
110183.desc: Terrifying tusks left behind during the borisins' conquests. Used to level up Traces significantly for Destruction characters.
110183.story_desc: Borisins can further enhance their bodies through their innate "Moon Madness." The battle-frenzied warriors exhibit incredible healing abilities, shedding the blood of their enemies in a sanguine mist together with the unbridled growth of their muscles and bones. "O, Brood Lord, grant us divine strength."

110221.name: Fiery Spirit
110221.desc: Feeble heliobus that scattered after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces slightly for Nihility characters.
110221.story_desc: An innocent, formless heliobus. The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. This little heliobus is innocent and naive and may be easily consumed by more powerful heliobi. "Formless, rootless, and roaming boundless..."

110222.name: Starfire Essence
110222.desc: A mature heliobus that ran away after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces moderately for Nihility characters.
110222.story_desc: A mean and nasty heliobus that appears like a full flame. The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. This torch-like heliobus has just tasted consciousness and is eager to devour its host's emotions and desires. "Absorb their emotions and sway their wills..."

110223.name: Heaven Incinerator
110223.desc: A beast-form heliobus that homogenized after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces significantly for Nihility characters.
110223.story_desc: An intelligent and powerful heliobus that has started to take the form of a beast. The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. A large heliobus, having homogenized its numerous lesser peers, will gradually have a stable shape. These immortal beings can become so dangerous that they are considered calamities. "Floods, fires, landslides, and thunderstorms..."

110231.name: Firmament Note
110231.desc: Scattered note from the firmament. Used to level up Traces slightly for Harmony characters.
110231.story_desc: A musical note scattered from order. Falling silently from the edge of the clouds, it blends into the symphony of mortal sounds, like a tear dissolving into the sea. "No one hears it until it dissolves into a song..."

110232.name: Celestial Section
110232.desc: Melodious section fallen from the heavens. Used to level up Traces moderately for Harmony characters.
110232.story_desc: A musical section scattered from order. Falling silently from the edge of the heavens, it blends into the cacophony, like grains of sand scattered in the desert. "No one notices it until it ignites a spark of inspiration..."

110233.name: Heavenly Melody
110233.desc: Symphonic movements from the cosmos. Used to level up Traces significantly for Harmony characters.
110233.story_desc: A piece of music scattered from order. It quietly echoes from beyond the heavens, drowned out by profound silence, like a lone star twinkling in a river of stars. "No one feels it until it is forgotten by all ♬..."

110400.name: Enigmatic Ectostella
110400.desc: A fathomless crystal. Ascension material for the Trailblazer.
110400.story_desc: Severed from the highest of beings, this crystal reflects ever-changing mirages. The past and future intertwine on each of its countless facets, attempting to swallow up all observers. "Civilization is but a thin sheet of ice on top of the deep dark ocean of chaos."

110401.name: Broken Teeth of Iron Wolf
110401.desc: Fragmented saw teeth left behind by automatons. Can be used for the Ascension of Physical characters.
110401.story_desc: It is said that the smelting techniques of the Architects allowed them to make chainsaws sturdy enough to split giant boulders. Such techniques have been long lost to history. "Boss Svarog says its blade is so thin that it can cut into the gap between molecules... What are molecules?"

110402.name: Endotherm Chitin
110402.desc: Hot, translucent substance almost like fire in the solid state. Can be used for the Ascension of Fire characters.
110402.story_desc: Strange chitin peeled off from an interdimensional creature. Although not piping hot anymore, it still radiates warmth. "It's too cold outside. But with this gemstone on you, you'll be able to travel far and wide, even to search for cities with humans left..."
come_from: Stagnant Shadow: Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone

110403.name: Horn of Snow
110403.desc: Broken horn of a Frigid Prowler. Can be used for the Ascension of Ice characters.
110403.story_desc: The Silvermane Guards would host contests where the winner must take a body part from a monster and bring it back within a set time limit. This cold broken horn must have been a trophy of one such contest. "Sir Bova, this is no moose horn and is certainly not fit for decoration above the Geomarrow furnace."
come_from: Stagnant Shadow: Corridor of Fading Echoes

110404.name: Lightning Crown of the Past Shadow
110404.desc: Headwear of the Guardian Shadows. Can be used for the Ascension of Lightning characters.
110404.story_desc: Accessory left behind by the shadow of a past Guardian, telling tales of the city of Everwinter. "Svetlana the Iron Fist — her wrath as terrifying as thunder and her retribution as swift as lightning."
come_from: Stagnant Shadow: Corridor of Fading Echoes

110405.name: Storm Eye
110405.desc: Arrows belonged to a Stormbringer. Can be used for the Ascension of Wind characters.
110405.story_desc: Used to belong to a certain Fragmentum monster modeled after a certain kind of Voidrangers. An arrowhead can be barely seen buried in the center of the vortex. "Those who perish in the Fragmentum shall rise again where they met their demise."

110406.name: Void Cast Iron
110406.desc: Horseshoe of a Voidranger: Trampler. Can be used for the Ascension of Quantum characters.
110406.story_desc: Rare horseshoe obtained when a Trampler of the Antimatter Legion is defeated. When no one is observing, it pops in and out of existence. "The name of the experiment? It's just called "Horseshoe of the Trampler"... "

110407.name: Golden Crown of the Past Shadow
110407.desc: Headwear of the Decaying Shadow. Can be used for the Ascension of Imaginary characters.
110407.story_desc: Accessory left behind by the shadow of a past Guardian, telling tales of the city of Everwinter. "Alina the Loving — her kindness as lofty as the sky and her compassion as brilliant as gold."

110411.name: Netherworld Token
110411.desc: The Aurumaton Spectral Envoy's weapon. Can be used for the Ascension of Physical characters.
110411.story_desc: This is both a weapon used by the Ten-Lords Commission messengers to subdue mara and abominations, as well as a token they present when undertaking operations. No authorities of the mortal realm have jurisdiction over them. "Messengers of Netherworld, authorized envoys of death's realm. Bearing orders for apprehension, with no pardon for transgressors."

110412.name: Searing Steel Blade
110412.desc: The broken blade of a Searing Prowler. Can be used for the Ascension of Fire-Type characters.
110412.story_desc: The Silvermane Guards would host contests where the winner must take a body part from a monster and bring it back within a set time limit. This broken blade must have been a trophy of one such contest. "I saw it with my own eyes. Captain Gepard smashed that thing's hot steel blade with one blow of his fist, then held it with his bare hands and plunged it into the belly of that cold fatty, warming its heart."

110413.name: Gelid Chitin
110413.desc: Frosty chitin emitting a cold humming. Can be used for the Ascension of Ice characters.
110413.story_desc: Strange chitin peeled off from an interdimensional creature. Although not freezing cold anymore, it remains trembling, absorbing heat from its surroundings. "How has no one thought of selling it to worlds where they don't have air conditioners? It works like an air conditioner and sounds as loud as one, too."

110414.name: Shape Shifter's Lightning Staff
110414.desc: A wooden staff with a pointed tip. It belonged to a shape shifter from the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus. Can be used for the Ascension of Lightning characters.
110414.story_desc: According to ancient Xianzhou records, those who have ascended can summon lightning and command the wind. The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus claimed to have inherited the way of the gods. By demonstrating godly power, the disciples gathered large numbers of worshipers in secret. Branches of lightning coil around this wooden staff — could it be that the disciples were indeed no mere mortals? "The mortal body is but an illusion. Truth is only revealed to those who choose to ascend."

110415.name: Ascendant Debris
110415.desc: Remains of The Ascended. Can be used for Ascension of Wind characters.
110415.story_desc: The Ascended originally intended to bring the world a legacy of kindness, but as the bestowment of Abundance fades, understanding arrives alongside liberation: They were nothing more than a mortal with flesh and blood. Their ability to traverse the skies was nothing but an illusion, and all that remained of their existence was dust and dirt. "I curse ye, Reignbow Arbiter..."

110416.name: Nail of the Ape
110416.desc: Remnant of an Abundance Sprite. Can be used for the Ascension of Quantum characters.
110416.story_desc: The distinction between "sprite" and "abomination" is merely a matter of name. A sprite is tamed and obedient, while an abomination is an uncontrolled misfortune. This nail embedded in the body of the Malefic Ape serves as an eternal guarantee of its status as a sprite. "As a disciple, it is your duty to obey. If the Master Primus drives this Possession Nail into your body, then you will have no choice but to obey, won't you?"

110417.name: Suppressing Edict
110417.desc: Parts used in the Xianzhou ingenium technology. Can be used for the Ascension of Imaginary characters.
110417.story_desc: After Rubert unleashed the calamity of inorganic life, the aurumaton in Xianzhou also rebelled and began a ruthless slaughter. To ensure that the turmoil does not resurface, the craftsmen imposed imprisonment using talismans, stripping the aurumaton of their ability to think. "What on earth did you do to make this fellow go mad?" "I didn't do anything! I just... cleaned that golden talisman a bit."

110423.name: Dream Fridge
110423.desc: The fridge carried by Sweet Gorilla. Can be used for the Ascension of Ice characters.
110423.story_desc: A special SoulGlad fridge designed to preserve icy sweetness. It serves as a tool for transporting drinks for the Sweet Dreams Troupe, and can also be wielded as a weapon when they are transformed into the Dreamjolt Troupe. "Notice: The Sweet Dreams Troupe serves as an outsourcing company for transportation, and SoulGlad Enterprise does not bear any liability in the event of accidents."

110426.name: Dream Flamer
110426.desc: A flamer that instantly cooks food. Can be used for the Ascension of Quantum characters.
110426.story_desc: A special fiery dream flamer that uses flames to serve a delicious dream on the plate. It serves as a tool for the Sweet Dreams Troupe's cooking, and can also be wielded as a weapon when they are transformed into the Dreamjolt Troupe. "By design, the flames from this flamer affect only ingredients... although that doesn't exclude the possibility of the head chef regarding you as an ingredient."

110501.name: Destroyer's Final Road
110501.story_desc: The Leviathan's heart has stopped beating, but its mind lives on despite being trapped in a case. As long as the lid is closed, its mind is simultaneously both alive and dead, driving the engine of destruction. "Doomsday Beast, a blight made in the Warforge using what's left of a Leviathan and the weeping bones of thousands of the dead. It longs for the destruction of the universe and itself."

110502.name: Guardian's Lament
110502.story_desc: Together with this visor, the twisted wish of a Guardian also lies broken. She had wanted to find a way out for her people to escape the Everwinter, but ended up becoming a puppet of a consciousness beyond her. "Supreme Guardian, the title passed down to generations of Belobog's rulers, the one who looked after all the people — It never occurred to anyone that the Guardians themselves also long for care and protection."

110503.name: Regret of Infinite Ochema
110503.story_desc: No matter how many bodies it steals, its wish remains unfulfilled. Like those who seek the medicines of immortality, it craves an imperishable vessel, one that will rid it of its fear of destruction. And yet, it knows this is a dream that will never come true. "I have seen countless worlds devoured by The Blemished One's conflagration, and I was one of their flames. I danced at the twirl of their fingers, keenly aware that should the fuel burn out, this fire will also extinguish..."

110504.name: Past Evils of the Borehole Planet Disaster
110504.story_desc: As a descendant bred personally by the Imperator Insectorum, its only desire is to expand the numbers of its kind. It uses giant scythes to harvest planets for its nest, tirelessly nurturing countless offspring, and devastating innumerable lives until the moment of its death. "On the broken planet, giant locusts blotted out the sky, and swarms of insects poured out of the planet's crust. The stag beetle raised this new nest and presented it as a gift to its Imperator Insectorum... May this horror only exist in historical records, never to appear again."

111001.name: Extinguished Core
111001.desc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Crude material used for enhancement.
111001.story_desc: It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion. A heavy blow has caused this heart to stop beating and lose its luster. "Preliminary tests indicate it's some kind of hybrid: one half is primordial, and the other half is something very similar to Stellarons." — Department of Biology, Sarah Castro

111002.name: Glimmering Core
111002.desc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Normal material used for enhancement.
111002.story_desc: It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion. The heart is glimmering and the veins on it indicate it's still alive. "What kind of monster is this? Did you see it... Its face! It has the face of our previous leader!"
come_from: Certain Fragmentum Monsters at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

111003.name: Squirming Core
111003.desc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Advanced material used for enhancement.
111003.story_desc: It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion. The heart is pulsating slowly, with a residual force powerful enough to cause a new calamity. It's best to destroy it to prevent further troubles. "It's like a cancer..."
come_from: Certain Fragmentum Monsters at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

111011.name: Thief's Instinct
111011.desc: A small amount of anti-matter. Crude material used for enhancement.
111011.story_desc: A small amount of anti-matter that emanates out of the Voidranger: Reaver like the materialization of its destructive instinct. "They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."

111012.name: Usurper's Scheme
111012.desc: A moderate amount of anti-matter. Normal material used for enhancement.
111012.story_desc: A moderate amount of anti-matter that floats around the Voidranger: Distorter. The amount of matter and anti-matter particles has reached a dangerous balance... "They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."
come_from: Antimatter Legion at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

111013.name: Conqueror's Will
111013.desc: Condensed anti-matter. Advanced material used for enhancement.
111013.story_desc: Highly condensed anti-matter within the body of the Voidranger: Trampler. The moment of obliteration is the trumpet call for civilizations' destruction. "They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."
come_from: Antimatter Legion at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

112001.name: Silvermane Badge
112001.desc: Pin badge worn by soldiers of the Silvermane Guards. Crude material used for enhancement.
112001.story_desc: It is full of scratches from the erosion of wind and snow. "In ancient times, there was only one way Silvermane Guards could retire: death."

112002.name: Silvermane Insignia
112002.desc: Military rank insignia worn by captains of the Silvermane Guard. Normal material used for enhancement.
112002.story_desc: Maybe it's a proof of heroics that you can brag about to your family. Maybe it's a lucky charm that protects you from a bullet. "Times have changed."
come_from: Everwinter Shadewalker and Incineration Shadewalker at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher
Silvermane Guards and vagrants at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

112003.name: Silvermane Medal
112003.desc: Medal of honor worn by soldiers of the Silvermane Guards with gallant and meritorious service. Advanced material used for enhancement.
112003.story_desc: A proof of honor awarded to those that fought against Fragmentum creatures, Underworlders, and sudden disasters. It is not usually pinned onto the recipient's chest, but rather placed onto his coffin. "Remember, young Gepard. It is not a toy: it is the destiny and blood of the Landau family."
come_from: Everwinter Shadewalker and Incineration Shadewalker at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher
Silvermane Guards and vagrants at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

112011.name: Ancient Part
112011.desc: Mechanical part left behind from the Old World. Crude material used for enhancement.
112011.story_desc: Despite its size, it was cast and polished in a way that people today would struggle to replicate. "A small screw in the Old World is stronger than our armor."

112012.name: Ancient Spindle
112012.desc: Mechanical spindle left behind from the Old World. Normal material used for enhancement.
112012.story_desc: Once taken apart, the precision components can never be put back together. Even the maintenance veterans in Belobog's Technology Division would think twice before touching it. "You idiot, the Bluecoats will only give you a few canned goods for this. Take it to Boss Svarog and you won't need to worry about food and clothing for a while."
come_from: Automatons at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

112013.name: Ancient Engine
112013.desc: Mechanical engine left behind from the Old World. Advanced material used for enhancement.
112013.story_desc: It uses Geomarrow as the energy source. When powered, it spews wandering auroras, not sparkles. "Only the Technology Division directly under the Supreme Guardian has access to information regarding the Old World. I lost my privileges after I was fired."
come_from: Automatons at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

113001.name: Immortal Scionette
113001.desc: New and young shoot budding from an ancient divine construct. Crude material used for enhancement.
113001.story_desc: The source of the Xianzhou long-life species' "Endless Lifespan." The remnants of the Aeon of Abundance's influence. Countless years ago, a sovereign's hubris for immortality caused the Xianzhou fleet to sail into the sea of outer space to seek divine recipes. "We desire to live for endless ages and maintain the empire for all eternity. Unfortunately, human lives have limits and human capacity has its ends. Thus, we send nine Navium Astriger to sail beyond the sky, seeking divine recipes for immortality."

113002.name: Immortal Aeroblossom
113002.desc: New flowers blooming out of an ancient divine construct. Normal material used for enhancement.
113002.story_desc: The source of the Xianzhou long-life species' "Endless Lifespan." The remnants of the Aeon of Abundance's influence. After endless trials, the fleet seeking the medicine of immortality was able to behold the visage of the celestial being. The divine one cast down its blessings in material form, and the Ambrosial Arbor sprouted its leaves. "New buds descend into the moon, divine flowers bloom by the clouds. In the blink of a blossom's life, old wood returns to youthful grove."
come_from: Abominations of Abundance at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

113003.name: Immortal Lumintwig
113003.desc: Deciduous twigs from an ancient divine construct. Advanced material used for enhancement.
113003.story_desc: The source of the Xianzhou long-life species' "Endless Lifespan." The remnants of the Aeon of Abundance's influence. After the Three Sufferings, Xianzhou laid in devastation. The Homo celestinae fell as demons, and catastrophes occurred ceaselessly. "As decreed by the Ten-Lords Commission, all who are near the mara-struck state will be seized by the infernal judges and cast into the Shackling Prison."
come_from: Abominations of Abundance at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

113011.name: Artifex's Module
113011.desc: Components used in Xianzhou's ingenium creations. Crude material used for enhancement.
113011.story_desc: The foundation of Xianzhou's ingenium technology. The smallest constituent of all machine parts. Breaking it apart would be akin to destroying the cellular structure of a living being. "The Intelligentsia Guild put up a bounty of two million credits for technical plans that can flawlessly disassemble Xianzhou mechanical puppets." "If you know Screwllum, then these two millions are basically yours to take..."

113012.name: Artifex's Cogwheel
113012.desc: Parts of the Xianzhou machines. Normal material used for enhancement.
113012.story_desc: The connective components used in Xianzhou's ingenium technology. The intricate and thin teeth of the cogwheels are as minute as mustard seeds, and yet are interconnected to form a complex body, making the machine able to pass as true life. "Its form lies in harmony, a parallel to nature. Its movements cyclical, echoing the cosmos."
come_from: Entranced Ingenia at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

113013.name: Artifex's Gyreheart
113013.desc: Components used in Xianzhou's ingenium creations. Advanced material used for enhancement.
113013.story_desc: The core of Xianzhou's ingenium technology. The armillary sphere roils and vibrates like the essence of a heart, making the machine think like a living being. "Do not be startled. Taking away its heart would make him... her?... No, make it lose its sentience and return to its mechanical sources."
come_from: Entranced Ingenia at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

114001.name: Dream Collection Component
114001.desc: A storage device for Dreamscape creations. Crude material used for enhancement.
114001.story_desc: A storage device for broken dreams, providing a fundamental energy source for Dreamscape creations. "Install this device, and you will get a member of the Sweet Dreams Troupe."

114002.name: Dream Flow Valve
114002.desc: A control component for Dreamscape creations. Normal material used for enhancement.
114002.story_desc: A dream-building device that regulates desires and controls the Dreamscape creations' emotions. "If this device fails, you will get a member of the Dreamjolt Troupe."
come_from: Dreamjolt Troupe at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

114003.name: Dream Making Engine
114003.desc: An energy core for Dreamscape creations. Advanced material used for enhancement.
114003.story_desc: A dream-building device that constructs fantasies and grants souls to Dreamscape creations. "If this device malfunctions... try to wake up before you descend into a nightmare, my friend."
come_from: Dreamjolt Troupe at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

114011.name: Tatters of Thought
114011.desc: A memoria fragment of fleeting thought. Crude material used for enhancement.
114011.story_desc: Within the Memory Zone, thousands of thoughts flutter like dust. Broken thoughts accumulate, serving as nourishment and components for memes. "A fleeting thought may dissipate into thin air or amass into obsessions."

114012.name: Fragments of Impression
114012.desc: A memoria fragment of profound impression. Normal material used for enhancement.
114012.story_desc: Within the Memory Zone, the form memories float as fleeting glimmers of light, and only profound and memorable fragments can condense it crystals. "Memory is not a mere replication of past sensations, but a reconstruction of past impressions."
come_from: Memory Zone Meme at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

114013.name: Shards of Desires
114013.desc: A memoria fragment of obsessive desires. Advanced material used for enhancement.
114013.story_desc: Within the Memory Zone, memoria of desires develops ceaselessly. It absorbs thoughts and impressions, nurtures magic mirrors of desires, and reflects the eerie shadows of memetic entities. "Memory points to the past, while desire points to the future. Seek desires from memory will cause dreams to become inverted, and inner demons will naturally be born."
come_from: Memory Zone Meme at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

120000.name: Hertareum
120000.desc: The cryptocurrency circulating internally in the Herta Space Station. Can be used to purchase goods in Special Stores.
120000.story_desc:
Hertareum was planned as a digital currency, but eventually settled as a physical currency.
It's worth mentioning that even though Hertareum coins don't contain any precious metal components, the high-definition silhouette Non-Fungible Token contained inside it is much more valuable than any of them.

120001.name: Shield
120001.desc: The official currency circulating in Belobog. Can be used to purchase goods in Special Stores.
120001.story_desc:
After a long era of blockades, the Overworld and Underworld denizens of Belobog have developed vastly different standards for currency.
The current exchange rate of shield to credits is now 1:50... Speaking of, why are credits still an official currency of Belobog? It seems people have already forgotten the answer to this question.

120002.name: Strale
120002.desc: The internal currency of the Xianzhou Alliance with strales as its basic monetary unit. Can be used to purchase goods in Special Stores.
120002.story_desc: The Xianzhou strales has long been digitized before Xianzhou's interactions with the IPC ever happened. However, there are some collectors who still kept the Celest-Gold coins minted when the Alliance first came into existence. Shaped like the tip of an arrow or a narrow leaf, it seems to allude to the past and future of that civilization.

120003.name: Clock Credits
120003.desc: This is said to be a commemorative currency issued personally by the Watchmaker. Can only be used at the Clockie Statue.
120003.story_desc: A mysterious banknote, whose origin is unknown even to The Family. It features the classic image of Clockie on the front. This currency is prohibited for regular transactions in the Dreamscape world, and only a few people know its true purpose.

121000.name: Lil' Twisty Bubble Gum
121000.desc: A tasty and cheap Punklorde snack. Can be used to Superimpose the Light Cone "Before the Tutorial Mission Starts."
121000.story_desc: A candy favored by a certain Stellaron Hunter. It contains rocket tree gum, and the crispy sound of bubbles popping is absolutely irresistible. "Pop!"

121001.name: Exorcismal Fulu
121001.desc: The special talisman used by the Ten-Lords Commission to suppress heliobi. It can be used to superimpose the Light Cone "Hey, Over Here."
121001.story_desc: "Decree of Nine Chapters, myriad spirits concealed."
come_from: Obtained via leveling your popularity level in "Ghostly Grove"

122000.name: Aideen Tokens
122000.story_desc: A token for amusement facilities at Aideen Park. Despite their large size, they are exceptionally lightweight. Q: What is something that the more you possess, the less wealth you have? A: Gambler's chips.

140000.name: Praise of High Morals
140000.story_desc:
In this grand universe, moral standards are materialized into physical form. Thumbs-up approvals aren't a rare sight to behold.
What matters is that you are recognized!

140004.name: Ancient Coin
140004.story_desc: An old coin from a time when metal was still a plentiful resource in Belobog.
come_from: Found in destructible objects in Jarilo-VI

140017.name: Core Module
140017.story_desc: Defective parts collected from a malfunctioning robot. "You get what you pay for. Obviously, this is worthless."

140021.name: Thermal-Powered Mechanical Mining Pick
140021.story_desc: According to Sampo, it's a piece of mining equipment that he lost. "A pickaxe with a polished point might make for a decent weapon?"

140022.name: Anti-Dust Mask
140022.story_desc: According to Sampo, it's a piece of mining equipment that he lost. "An ordinary respirator."

140023.name: Customized Pink Safety Helmet
140023.story_desc: According to Sampo, it's a piece of mining equipment that he lost. "Put it on and you'll be the finest in the mines."

140024.name: Strange Drill Ornament
140024.story_desc: A strange ornament you found in the Corridor of Fading Echoes resembling a delicate drill. "'Balakin' is inscribed onto the back. Your intuition tells you this device isn't something simple..."

140025.name: Balakin Family Box
140025.story_desc: An iron box passed down by the Balakin family, containing secrets left behind by their ancestors hundreds of years ago. "My ancestors left behind the iron box, but forgot to leave its key. Funny, very funny."

140026.name: Device Encryption Key
140026.story_desc: An encryption key used to activate the energy core in the restricted zone. "Despite its apparent similarities to other cores, it is clear the energy core inside the Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone is highly-customized."

140027.name: Terminal Encryption Key
140027.story_desc: A custom key that can unlock the gear bridge inside the Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone. Only officers are granted access permissions.

140032.name: Temporary Visitor Pass
140032.story_desc: A temporary pass allowing entry into the Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone. "Temporary workers in possession of this temporary pass may enter the restricted zone within three hours. Lending this pass to others is a felony, and offenders will suffer serious consequences."

140033.name: Mine Cart Pin
140033.story_desc: A part used to connect the body and chassis of a mine cart. "It is this small part that supports the entire structural integrity of the mine cart."

140034.name: Robot Settlement Level 1 Certification
140034.story_desc: Level-1 certification for opening the entrance of the Robot Settlement. Only those who have obtained all three certification levels can gain permission to open the door. "Hey, ow! Ow, ow, ow... Can't this robot be more gentle with a pretty girl's hand?"

140035.name: Robot Settlement Level 2 Certification
140035.story_desc: Level-2 certification for opening the entrance of the Robot Settlement. Only those who have obtained all three certification levels can gain permission to open the door. "Hey, ow! Ow, ow, ow... Can't this robot be more gentle with a pretty girl's hand?"

140036.name: Robot Settlement Level 3 Certification
140036.story_desc: Level-3 certification for opening the entrance of the Robot Settlement. Only those who have obtained all three certification levels can gain permission to open the door. "Hey, ow! Ow, ow, ow... Can't this robot be more gentle with a pretty girl's hand?"

140037.name: Space Station Special Permit
140037.story_desc: A Space Station Special Permit issued by Asta and Arlan. Allows you to freely enter and exit most cabins of the space station. "Why not all cabins you ask? Let's just say, researchers of Herta Space Station are all crouching tigers, I don't want to limit their imaginations when it comes to unlocking things."

140039.name: Mine Cart Wheelset
140039.story_desc: A part used for connecting mine cart wheels. "A sturdy axle connects two mine cart wheels."

140040.name: A Bottle of Glass Marbles
140040.story_desc: Proof of Julian's capacities. "There are no masters and newbies with marbles. Only those who grab the opportunities can win."

140041.name: Julian's Time Capsule
140041.story_desc: Treasure across time. "I didn't dig out ninety percent of the time capsules."

140046.name: Commercial District Key
140046.story_desc: A key that can be used in the Rivet Town Commercial District. "The Fragmentum has come and everyone has fled. What Chamber of Commerce?"

140065.name: Junjun, the Cuddly Bear
140065.story_desc: A big bear doll that has been stashed away. "Natasha's hand-made bear doll. Admittedly, it is rather cute."

140066.name: Treasure Map
140066.story_desc: A map that supposedly leads to treasure. "A Treasure Map that looks rather sketchy. Is it... accurate?"

140067.name: Real Treasure Map
140067.story_desc: A map that supposedly leads to treasure. "A Treasure Map made a long time ago. Judging by how old it is, seems quite convincing."

140068.name: Fragmentum Monster Armor
140068.story_desc: Chitin that looks like armor, taken from a Fragmentum Monster. "Who wants something like this..."

140069.name: Used Item Auction Pamphlet
140069.story_desc: A pamphlet about the used item auction. "A way for vagrants to trade... an auction sounds like a good idea."

140070.name: Logistic Navigation Map
140070.story_desc: A navigation map with "recipient address" marked on it. "Heron Express would like to warn you about the latest scam, 'We left your delivery at your door.'"

140071.name: Ultra Nickel Part
140071.story_desc: Intricate parts dotted around the Disposal Site. Hardly anyone would notice these dated-looking dull little things. Iron and nickel are gifts from the shooting star, but ultra nickel is something entirely different... Produced with mysterious methods, this superalloy, though outdated in the eyes of Herta, is patented and has no competition in the entire universe. "No competition? You get one of these for 10 credits on the black market. They say you can use it to repair all the beacons in the universe, very versatile."

140072.name: Red Signal Log
140072.story_desc: A signal log in which is recorded the affirmative answer from Lesley and the truth about the starquake. It is sweet yet cruel. "Knowing how Rocky is, even I can't predict what he might do when he learns the truth."

140073.name: Blue Signal Log
140073.story_desc: A fake log with Lesley's answer. Whoever made this hopes to maintain the fragile balance of Rocky's life using abrupt rejection. "She will say no to him and his life will go on. It's always easier to forget than to heal."

140074.name: Surveillance Footage
140074.story_desc: A clip of the footage captured by the Herta Panopticon System. With all researchers under constant watch, there's no keeping secrets. "Surveillance is the bane of secrets but also the best historian-to-be. You can trace back to the beginning of everything, be it good or bad."

140075.name: Videotape: Dim Blue Dot
140075.story_desc: A videotape that recorded the intricate secrets of the space station. Its maker went the extra mile in making it secure by installing a most extraordinary security mechanism. "As if you have fallen into a space that has neither beginning nor end, you look through a standard-issue navigation visor and stare into the deepest retreat of the vast universe. In the distance, you see a dim blue dot, like a drop of water before the canvas of darkness."

140076.name: Videotape: Justice
140076.story_desc: A videotape that recorded the intricate secrets of the space station. Its maker went the extra mile in making it secure by installing a most extraordinary security mechanism. "That's the most direct evidence of the power of the Aeons. The justice people are seeking seems almost amusing in the face of a doomed planet... The hollow and eerily fast utterance is proof that the last bit of the videotape has been corrupted by something."

140077.name: Videotape: Doomsday
140077.story_desc: A videotape that recorded the intricate secrets of the space station. Its maker went the extra mile in making it secure by installing a most extraordinary security mechanism. "There are no reinforcements. If you can, please come back following the route we agreed on in advance. Do you copy? The intermittent sound from the cosmic radio is calling a name repeatedly. There is no reply."

140078.name: Misdelivered Letter 1
140078.story_desc:
An envelope found in Belobog.
The envelope reads: Dear kindhearted soul, can you buy me a stamp and post this for me? A thousand thanks!
Maybe someone in the Overworld can help you with this unsent letter.

140079.name: Misdelivered Letter 2
140079.story_desc:
An envelope found in Belobog.
The envelope reads: To Carlo Eyre, Room B03, Building 35, 6th Street, Administrative District.
Maybe someone in the Overworld can help you with this unsent letter.

140080.name: Misdelivered Letter 3
140080.story_desc:
An envelope found in Belobog.
The envelope reads: To my one and only; my precious; my eternally youthful; my clever and witty; the one worthy of all my love to protect; the one who may not even exist: The true love of my future.
Maybe someone in the Overworld can help you with this unsent letter.

140081.name: Misdelivered Letter 4
140081.story_desc:
An envelope found in Belobog.
The envelope reads: The trash I wrote should never see the light of day. That's fine, it can rot forever in the bottom of the dark mailbox.
Maybe someone in the Overworld can help you with this unsent letter.

140082.name: Milk Powder Package
140082.story_desc: One of the anonymous packages delivered to the clinic. "Milk powder and a thermal baby bottle. Very thoughtful indeed..."

140083.name: Anonymous Package
140083.story_desc: Anonymous package not yet delivered to the clinic. "Next to the anonymous package lies its sender."

140084.name: Thousand Stars Access Authentication
140084.story_desc: A mysterious card used to access an unknown facility. Its corner has been chipped away and the letters on it have become unrecognizable. But when you hold it under the light at a certain angle, you can see the faint letters that read "Thousand Stars." "Obviously this card was extremely valuable, but it was discarded like trash when someone lost interest... Sounds like something Herta would do."

140085.name: ██ Access Authentication
140085.story_desc: A mysterious card used to access an unknown facility. Its corner has been chipped away and the letters on it have become unrecognizable. But when you hold it under the light at a certain angle, you can see the faint letters that read "██." "When you run your fingers past the incomprehensible letters, you can't help but think: maybe this card is one of those collector's edition things. Could it be that having all the cards can grant you the power to summon... that Aeon?"

140086.name: Corporate Access Authentication
140086.story_desc: A mysterious card used to access an unknown facility. Its corner has been chipped away, and the letters on it have become unrecognizable. But when you hold it under the light at a certain angle, you can see the faint letters that read "Corporate." "Trust me, this is no doubt an access card used to open multiple layers of secured hatches, and it must have been developed by big corporations. The room it unlocks must also have been built by some pan-cosmic magnate."

140090.name: Box of Rubbing Alcohol
140090.story_desc: A box of medical supplies urgently needed by Natasha. "Rubbing alcohol — hope it hasn't evaporated too much..."

140091.name: Box of Special Painkillers
140091.story_desc: A box of medical supplies urgently needed by Natasha. "Natasha's home-made painkillers. People faint just from the smell."

140095.name: Children's Book Package
140095.story_desc: One of the anonymous packages delivered to the clinic. "Children fall asleep to stories. A must-try for young parents..."

140096.name: Toddler Clothing Package
140096.story_desc: One of the anonymous packages delivered to the clinic. "Soft and breathable, our quality clothing is designed to protect your baby from sweat. Perfect for silky-smooth skin."

140097.name: Kluzer's Letter
140097.story_desc: Old letters that Kluzer carries around. "He didn't have the time to post them... maybe he didn't need to anymore..."

140098.name: Old Photo of Balakin
140098.story_desc: An old yellowing photo. Evidence of a certain individual's part in a certain historic event. The figure in the picture did not seem to plan to let people feel the historical weight this photo should carry. "What will become of Belobog in a hundred years? Well, you'll have to see it through your eyes."

140103.name: Commodity Contract
140103.story_desc: Commodity contract for the auction. Use it to get paid based on the value of the goods. "They always put 'Handle with Care' on the contract but everyone ignores it."

140104.name: Geomarrow Probe
140104.story_desc: Rare relic from ancient times. Can be used with intricate Old World instruments. "A way for vagrants to trade... an auction sounds like a good idea."

140105.name: Letter From the Comet Hunter
140105.story_desc: Letter from outer space by Hosea Lazaro the comet hunter — full of rubbish. "Back when I was still in the space station, I would look into the night sky in search of those faraway celestial bodies. Those clouds of stars, soft and alluring, captured my anxious heart. If you are like me, it's only a matter of time before people crown you with the title 'comet hunter'."

140106.name: Letter From the Comet Hunter
140106.story_desc: Letter from outer space by Hosea Lazaro the comet hunter — full of rubbish. "Back when I was still in the space station, I would look into the night sky in search of those faraway celestial bodies. Those clouds of stars, soft and alluring, captured my anxious heart. If you are like me, it's only a matter of time before people crown you with the title 'comet hunter'."

140107.name: Letter From the Comet Hunter
140107.story_desc: Letter from outer space by Hosea Lazaro the comet hunter — full of rubbish. "Back when I was still in the space station, I would look into the night sky in search of those faraway celestial bodies. Those clouds of stars, soft and alluring, captured my anxious heart. If you are like me, it's only a matter of time before people crown you with the title 'comet hunter'."

140108.name: Xenohydro in a Case
140108.story_desc: The Xenohydro was confined within a Mystic Case in the shape of a trapezohedron, with one of the planes made from the Absolutely Objective Lens. It is observed that the Xenohydro has icy blue skin that has silver spots dotted around. If you look through other planes to observe the Xenohydro, you'll find that it looks rather different. In fact, the image of the Xenohydro will vary from person to person. "I have a feeling that compared with the Xenohydro, this case is the actual curio. It can be worth quite a lot on the curio market."

140109.name: Kapo-Kali Recipe
140109.story_desc: The king of soft drinks, rough around the edges but good for your buddies — give 'em the strong kick they deserve. "A big barrel of pure caramel, a few jumping peas here and there, a handful of fresh canterbury bells, and some interdimensional leaves. Don't forget a drop of Ambergris of Abundance and a few rolls of orchid zest. How much of a kick you want is your choice."

140111.name: Rusted Key
140111.story_desc: A key with its teeth all worn smooth and not looking like it can open doors anytime soon. "Rivet Town Chamber of Commerce? Ask Julian if he knows about it."

140112.name: Special Autoradiograph
140112.story_desc: A treasure map decoded with a Special Autoradiograph, revealing hidden coordinates within the space station. "I heard that scoundrel left behind some good stuff in the space station. This must be where the treasure is."

140114.name: Delicate Snow Globe
140114.story_desc: Bronya's toy as a child. The snowy owl circles above the snowfields, looking for the best opportunity to hunt the hare. "Even if our connection with the past is completely broken, there are still things that can complete us."

140115.name: Ball Peony
140115.story_desc: A very expensive flower. It blooms only once a year for a month. "But honestly, the price is completely worth that one month of bloom!"

140116.name: First Snow
140116.story_desc: An eight-petalled flower with white spots at each tip, just like snowflakes. "A long time ago, the initial snow of the year symbolized harvest and joy."

140117.name: Marquise
140117.story_desc: An aristocratic flower beloved by high society. "Rumor has it that a noblewoman spent her entire family's fortune on one of these flowers. This was why it was given the name Marquise."

140118.name: Sunshine
140118.story_desc: A lovely small red-and-yellow flower that looks like the sun. "Just looking at it makes you feel warm inside."

140119.name: Mechanical Parts
140119.story_desc: Common mechanical parts used everywhere. "The prospectors say this is the specialty of corners and gaps. It kinda makes sense..."

140120.name: Robot Shell
140120.story_desc: A metal casing removed from discarded robots. Maybe it can still be used. "It's common for animals to molt, but have you seen robots molt?"

140121.name: Flower Made From Scrap Iron
140121.story_desc: A cold metallic construct, but a burning passion perhaps hides beneath the petals. "It is cold to the touch, but warm if you put it against your body. Where on your body? Try your heart."

140123.name: Backup Batteries
140123.story_desc: Portable backup power source for the elevator. Can be used in an emergency after being assembled. "Safety and portability are both great, but the capacity... who designed this!?"

140124.name: Artisanship Commission Jade Seal
140124.story_desc: A token required to cross an important location.

140125.name: Mei's Notes: Flowers
140125.story_desc: This seems to be a note that Mei had dropped. Messy writing fills the page with records on how to look after some common flower species.

140126.name: Mei's Notes: Learning About Housework
140126.story_desc: This seems to be a note that Mei had dropped. Messy writing fills the page with records of what she had learned from other housekeepers.

140127.name: Mei's Testimony
140127.story_desc: Testimony that Tantan had recorded at the scene of the incident. It is no simple task to get useful information out of the victim's jumbled statements.

140128.name: Testimony From the Clumsy Lady
140128.story_desc: Testimony that Tantan had recorded at the scene of the incident. It is no simple task to get useful information out of the witness' jumbled statements.

140129.name: Testimony From the Suddenly Excited Man
140129.story_desc: Testimony that Tantan had recorded at the scene of the incident. It is no simple task to get useful information out of the witness' jumbled statements.

140130.name: Cycrane Surveillance Images
140130.story_desc: A picture of the lane taken by the cycrane. Starskiffs fly to and fro within the lane. The offending starskiff tried to hide within the traffic, only to expose itself.

140132.name: Master Capote's Fan Reply Card
140132.story_desc: Handwritten cards with words of encouragement from Capote to his fans. "Master Capote's care and love for everyone is contained in these words!"

140133.name: Master Capote's Limited-Edition Snapshot
140133.story_desc: A photo snapped from a unique angle and contains Capote's autograph. "Master Capote authorized it! It's not an intrusion of privacy!"

140134.name: Master Capote's Life Wiki
140134.story_desc: The wiki-style encyclopedia that Capote's fans created themselves. Its contents mostly involve Capote's sayings. "Master Capote's keyword in life has been updated. The most recent version is: illumination!"

140135.name: Arlan's ID Pass
140135.story_desc: A personal special pass belonging to Arlan, with Peppy's photo stuck to it. "Brother is certainly loyal, and he carries his good friend's photo whenever he goes."

140136.name: Broken Ceiling Tile
140136.story_desc: An alloy ceiling tile that is heavily damaged after a strong impact. "Will us Security Department have to... pay the bill for repairs?"

140137.name: Footprint
140137.story_desc: Arlan used too much force during combat and left a footprint on the floor tile. "We Security Department should use this as our insignia next year!"

140138.name: Photo of Arlan's Back
140138.story_desc: A photo of Arlan's back as he heads to the suspicious crystal on his own to investigate. The determination in his steps is obvious. "Brother is definitely a bear amongst horses! His figure is so cool!"

140139.name: Dirty Ribbon Tied to a Bell
140139.story_desc: A white ribbon stained beyond recognition by an unknown filth. A bell is pinned to the end of the delicate woven fabric, its chime guiding the blind girl through the darkness. "That familiar, crisp chime... Big Sis, are you back..."

140140.name: Damaged Music Box
140140.story_desc: A small, handcrafted music box. Though kept under good care for many years, it has fallen into a state of disrepair. The melody produced by the wooden box was somewhat unsettling, nonetheless, it was cherished by the two girls, who relied on each other like sisters. "Welcome... home..."

140141.name: Dark Fist Tournament Invitation Letter
140141.story_desc: A black envelope. A pitiful pin hangs on the spot where there should have been a fire lacquer seal. On the back is writing in large, crooked letters: "Invitation." "I see you're a chosen one..."

140146.name: Package for Peak
140146.story_desc: A package not delivered by Wildfire in time. Peak is its intended recipient.

140147.name: Package for Eunice
140147.story_desc: A package not delivered by Wildfire in time. The rapper Eunice is its intended recipient.

140148.name: Package With Illegible Recipient
140148.story_desc: A package not delivered by Wildfire in time. Its intended recipient could be one of the patients in the clinic.

140149.name: Wen Furui's Gift
140149.story_desc: Gaily wrapped gift. From the appearance, it can be seen that a lot of thought was spent on packaging this gift. "Giving disposable cutlery as a gift... You're implying that the recipient doesn't like to wash dishes."

140150.name: Dazzling Golden Watch
140150.story_desc: A watch that was almost mistaken for a bomb. It was said that a person's prized accessories can reflect their taste to an extent. "So I offered up three mansions in exchange for his watch..."

140151.name: A Bouquet of Ball Peonies
140151.story_desc: A bouquet of fresh Ball Peony blossoms. In floriography, it means "patience."

140152.name: A Bunch of Rainbows
140152.story_desc: A bunch of tiny Rainbow blossoms. In floriography, it means "the beauty of the ordinary."

140153.name: A Bouquet of First Snow
140153.story_desc: A bouquet of fresh First Snow blossoms. In floriography, it means "purity and kindness."

140154.name: A Stalk of Marquise
140154.story_desc: A stalk of exquisite Marquise blossoms. It represents a status of prestige.

140155.name: Gilbert's Message
