come_from: Cloudford: Mara-Struck Soldiers or other enemies
Found in destructible objects in Jarilo-VI

181008.name: Quantum Ripples
181008.story_desc: Ripples in the Sea of Quanta. Although called "ripples," they are in fact the most basic form of energy fluctuation. "Time, there's so much time." "All the time there is."
come_from: Rivet Town: Imaginary Weavers or other enemies

181009.name: Leaf of Imaginary
181009.story_desc: A leaf of unknown origin. It doesn't belong to any plant and is more of a representation of something more abstract. The ancient light nourishes the leaf through its veins, displaying its faded but remnant power. "One leaf, one world."
come_from: Backwater Pass: Flamespawns or other enemies

181010.name: Meteoric Alloy
181010.story_desc: Resilient meteoric ironsand. Its tenacity is far superior to solid boulders. "Let's grab as much as we can. Qlipoth will need them." "I have no idea whether the Aeon need them or not. All I know is that the IPC will pay big bucks for them."
come_from: Robot Settlement: Automatons or other enemies
Found in destructible objects in Jarilo-VI

181011.name: Jade Abacus Unit
181011.story_desc: The most essential component of jade abaci, commonly used in the final step of installation. "Pick one, they are all outdated models. But once installed, they will undoubtedly bring a soul-like essence to your machines."

181012.name: Extract of Medicinal Herbs
181012.story_desc: Medicinal herbs are the foundation of Xianzhou's medical practice, and these extracts capture the active ingredients from various herbs, enhancing their medicinal efficacy in leaps and bounds. "The value of 'tradition' lies in its ability to evolve and progress, rather than remaining stagnant."

181013.name: Tian Dong
181013.story_desc: While plants of the Tian Dong genus typically grow on land, Tian Dong plants of Scalegorge Waterscape stand out by extensively inhabiting the coastal areas of the Lunarescent Depths. Although artificial cultivation techniques for Tian Dong have become quite prevalent, there are still many who believe in the superstition that "wild plants have stronger medicinal properties," causing significant trouble for the Pearlkeepers. "Plunderers of Tian Dong, to the Shackling Prison they will go."

181014.name: Confounding
181014.story_desc: I've never been outstanding since I was a kid. I barely met the requirements to get into college, and I barely earned enough credits to obtain my degree. Now, I'm sitting at my desk, contemplating how to explain my understanding of "confusion" to you, but am I really worthy of showering you with my superficial understanding? And do you really need to listen to all this broken gibberish of mine? I don't know the answer. "Anyway, I hope you enjoy yourself."
come_from: The Reverie Hotel: Memory Zone Meme "Heartbreaker" or other enemies

181015.name: Hunger
181015.story_desc: In Penacony, "hunger" is an expensive spice that can make any food in the Dreamscape irresistible. In the world beyond dreams, "hunger" is the smile on the lips of death. "They say hunger is the best seasoning, but I just want to fill my stomach."
come_from: The Reverie Hotel: Memory Zone Meme "Heartbreaker" or other enemies

181016.name: Old Molar
181016.story_desc: No one knows the origin of this molar. The person selling it claims this extremely anachronistic item was found on the battlefield of the Emperor's War, infused by a bygone era of craftsmanship and defiance now lost in modern times. "It serves as the growth rings of inorganic life."
come_from: The Reverie Hotel: Dreamjolt Troupe's Mr. Domescreen or other enemies

182001.name: Strange Matter of Destruction
182001.story_desc: Strange matter that seems to possess the power of destruction. Resembling fire but not quite, it is neither cold nor hot and will damage anything that comes into contact with it for over 12 seconds. Could be the Antimatter Legion's version of trash. "Creatures that received blessing from Nanook all have twisted appearances."
come_from: Storage Zone: Voidranger: Reavers or other enemies

182002.name: Ambergris of Abundance
182002.story_desc: Jelly-like substance that contains the power of Abundance. Firm but not stiff, with notes of fragrance, it fills your heart with hope the moment it touches your fingertip. Do not ask what it's made of. "It gives you longevity and abundance, dispelling misfortune and illness."
come_from: Cloudford: Mara-Struck Soldiers or other enemies

182003.name: Stone of The Hunt
182003.story_desc: Small stone with the power of The Hunt. As if guided by someone's will, it moves by itself towards a certain direction. Sounds like what a magnet would do? I assure you it is not. "The destination lies where my arrow is heading."

182004.name: Preservation Construction Material
182004.story_desc: Construction materials that seem to possess the power of Preservation. When mixed with water it forms a paste, when exposed to air it turns rock-hard. Please do not use together with Solid Water. "I regret to say that Intelligentsia Guild's research on the material used to build the Subspace Crystalline Barrier by Amber Lord still needs time to reveal its nature." "I'm sure it's not cement — am I right, Taravan?"
come_from: Corridor of Fading Echoes: Everwinter Shadewalkers or other enemies

182005.name: Hard Chip of Nihility
182005.story_desc: A chip made of iron that seems to possess the power of Nihility. It may have been a coin that people use to buy things. But apparently, as the engravings on it fade away, its value went with them. "I don't know what I'm writing between these quotation marks. What's the point of this item description? My life is meaningless, so is this piece of flavor text."
come_from: Rivet Town: Imaginary Weavers or other enemies

182006.name: Tree Bark of Erudition
182006.story_desc: Dried tree bark that seems to possess the power of Erudition. Its creases tell the story of the years passed and the wisdom of nature. It says a lot more when beaten into pulp used for papermaking. "The wisdom of mankind is contained in this one word."
come_from: Robot Settlement: Automatons or other enemies

182007.name: Slime of Harmony
182007.story_desc: A torus that seems to possess the power of Harmony. It only has one surface. No matter where you depart, you're destined to not reach your destination. A tiny complaint would be that it is a bit sticky, as if it does not want to let you go. "All are connected and the wind of blessing breathes across the lands!"
come_from: Stargazer Navalia: Entranced Ingenium: Obedient Dracolion or other enemies

182008.name: Dragon Scale Coral
182008.story_desc: At the bottom of Lunarescent Depths, there is a diverse array of nearly a hundred coral species, among which dragon scale coral holds the greatest value. Within the coral skeleton of dragon scale coral, there is a rich concentration of Heavenly East compound. This compound serves as the finest antibiotic in the cosmos and possesses numerous other medicinal properties. Despite almost ten thousand years of efforts, humans have yet to learn how to industrially produce this compound. In front of the entrance to the Fanghu's Alchemy Commission stands a statue of dragon scale coral. Underneath it, there is an inscription that reads: "When you mistakenly believe you can control nature, always remember: nature is the ultimate biochemist."

182009.name: The Sound and the Fury
182009.story_desc: As you may have realized, the majority of sounds in this world are noise, and the majority of words are meaningless combinations. Don't let these distractions sway your judgment. "Life is like a fool's dream filled with the sound and the fury, but ultimately meaningless."
come_from: The Reverie Hotel: Memory Zone Meme "Heartbreaker" or other enemies

182010.name: Thermal Gel
182010.story_desc: Heat dissipation is a challenge that all Intellitrons must overcome. Although Intellitrons created using different generations of technology differ significantly in terms of materials and internal structures, traditional physical heat dissipation often remains the most suitable choice for many models. "It's just like organic beings bathing in water."
come_from: The Reverie Hotel: Dreamjolt Troupe's Mr. Domescreen or other enemies

183001.name: Interdimensional Leaf
183001.story_desc: The gravity of the planet Arivanta is not fixed. Rather, it changes all the time according to a Bode plot due to the influence of Arivanta's three moons. Ordinary life forms cannot survive such volatility, so the planet developed its unique eco-system, in which the herbal plant Interdimensional Tree is the most famous. For plants in a world where gravity is constantly subject to change, their leaves often have a hard time landing on the planet's ancient and solid ground. It is for this reason that the Interdimensional Trees tend to shake off their leaves rather late in the year. To help their leaves land, these trees, in the course of evolution, gave their leaves the ability to conduct fast short-distance warp-jumps towards the ground at frequencies that cannot be observed by naked eyes. Even so, not every leaf gets to land on the ground. Those lucky enough to make it watch others rise into the sky and burn as they are devoured by the atmosphere. "Wow."
come_from: Cloudford: Mara-Struck Soldiers or other enemies

183002.name: Phase Flame
183002.story_desc: Sserkal, #29 of the Genius Society, only lived 29 days by human measures of time. Despite that, she put her short life as a spider to good use, inventing new technologies that would have taken the spider-kind thousands of years to develop. Of all her inventions, the most famous must be the technique known as Phase Change. What people don't know is that this technique was first applied to experiments with ions. She successfully created Phase Flame, which almost immediately changed to another phase. By the time the Flame returned to the Sserkal Phase, our genius had already passed away. She tried to harness the Flame but had too little time to do so. Thus, the Phase Flame continued to change between phases across different worlds, leaving behind the seeds of flame. "Sserkal's life was remarkable. She was smart, kindhearted, and above all, humble. She remained curious and inquisitive, asking her final question in the club on the last day of her life, the answer to which has not been found to this day."
come_from: Robot Settlement: Automatons or other enemies

183003.name: Tear Crystal of Glorious Death
183003.story_desc: A Mourning Actor took a gondola and rowed towards a silent world of barrenness, humming an elegy for civilizations long gone. Not a single soul could be found at the site of the doomsday battlefield, but like nacre, the world that had turned into ashes gave birth to pearls of sorrow. The ghosts of the past condensed into clouds and rained down crystals like teardrops. The Actor held a fine grain of such crystal in hand and immediately heard in a dream the glorious chorus of civilizations at their height — heroes with godly might, starships like towering mountains, the whimper of stars, and the rage of the enemy. The Actor became restless in sleep, dragged into silent dreams. "Every single joy I had in my dreams breaks my heart."
come_from: Corridor of Fading Echoes: Everwinter Shadewalkers or other enemies

183004.name: Mythus Knots
183004.story_desc: To make the divine revelations of the Mythus even more mysterious, the History Fictionologists whipped up something known as Mythus Knots that contain a blend of rumors, secrets, legends, and myths. Historians would then blend such misinformation into what was supposed to be certain and rigid historical facts, with the aim to bring about a future of uncertainty for the universe. According to the History Fictionologists, the course of history is limited by the "narrative drive" in the minds of its observers. If something can be done to mix myths into facts, the universe will be covered in the "mist of uncertainty," allowing it to escape the calamity that is doomed to happen. "Scammers try to predict the future themselves, but prophets resort to higher powers."
come_from: Rivet Town: Imaginary Weavers or other enemies

183005.name: Weary
183005.story_desc: I'm tired of writing. I'm done with it. "This is what is called 'weariness.'"
come_from: The Reverie Hotel: Memory Zone Meme "Heartbreaker" or other enemies

183006.name: Mechanical Cube
183006.story_desc: According to legend, this is the heart of a prominent Intellitron leader, containing the Ultimate Source Code, the essence of all inorganic life. Scholars at the Intelligentsia Guild believe that this code holds the key to unraveling the mysteries of inorganic life. "It may also be the pathway for demons to return to the mortal world."
come_from: The Reverie Hotel: Dreamjolt Troupe's Mr. Domescreen or other enemies

190101.name: Floriography Manual Attached to a Bouquet
190101.desc: Floriography Manual Attached to a Bouquet
190101.story_desc: Floriography Manual Attached to a Bouquet

190120.name: Customer Notice From Balaway the Miner's Lamp
190120.desc: Customer Notice From Balaway the Miner's Lamp
190120.story_desc: Customer Notice From Balaway the Miner's Lamp

190122.name: Mythological Tales of Jarilo: God of Spring and War
190122.desc: Mythological Tales of Jarilo: God of Spring and War
190122.story_desc: Mythological Tales of Jarilo: God of Spring and War

190123.desc: Analysis of Jarilo: God of Spring and War
190123.story_desc: Analysis of Jarilo: God of Spring and War

190125.desc: Interview on Daily Life Before the Solwarm Festival
190125.story_desc: Interview on Daily Life Before the Solwarm Festival

190128.name: Diary of a Civilian Scientist Part 1
190128.desc: Diary of a Civilian Scientist Part 1
190128.story_desc: Diary of a Civilian Scientist Part 1

190129.name: Diary of a Civilian Scientist Part 2
190129.desc: Diary of a Civilian Scientist Part 2

190134.desc: The Traveler Who Survived the Blizzard

190140.name: Time Change Notice For Oratorio Rehearsal
190140.desc: Time Change Notice For Oratorio Rehearsal

190150.desc: Letter From the Comet Hunter Part 1

220000.name: The Art of Language
220000.desc: Chat Box for Message and Chat. Once obtained, they can be used in the Message or Chat functions
220000.story_desc: As a Trailblazer, not only should you carry out Akivili's will in your actions, you should also embody the style of the Trailblaze with your words!

220001.name: Where's the Rabbit?
220001.desc: Chat Box for Message and Chat. Once obtained, they can be used in the Message or Chat functions
220001.story_desc: "Perkins, be a good robot and open up the chest!" "I won't... I won't... not until Clara is back..."
come_from: Obtained from the Underground Treasure Hunt Event

220002.name: {TEXTJOIN#54}
220002.desc: Chat Box for Message and Chat. Once obtained, they can be used in the Message or Chat functions
220002.story_desc:
"Will {TEXTJOIN#54} dream of the Trailblazer?"
"...I don't know."
"But I know we will be the best travel buddies even in dreams."

220003.name: Celestial Incubator
220003.desc: Chat Box for Message and Chat. Once obtained, they can be used in the Message or Chat functions
220003.story_desc: The common thread between the birth of simulated celestial bodies and the creation of delicate pastries lies in their shared focus on nurturing "life."

221000.name: Nameless Journey
221000.desc: After obtaining Phone wallpapers, they can be changed in the Phone function
221000.story_desc: Every corner of the universe can bear the footprints of the Nameless, leaving their mark on the journey.

221001.name: Ingenium Dreams
221001.desc: After obtaining Phone wallpapers, they can be changed in the Phone function
221001.story_desc: "Where in Aurum Alley should we eat at today?" "The wait for dine-in at Aurum Alley is too long. Let's just order a delivery from the cycranes!"
come_from: Obtained from the Aurum Alley's Hustle and Bustle Event

221002.name: Conductor's Treat
221002.desc: After obtaining Phone wallpapers, they can be changed in the Phone function
221002.story_desc: "Let Pom-Pom cook! What kind of yum-yum do you guys have in mind?"

221003.name: Starfire Parkland
221003.desc: After obtaining Phone Wallpapers, they can be changed in the Phone function
221003.story_desc: "The previous host tasted so bitter, I couldn't bring myself to enjoy them..." "I like bitter! Shall I trade my sweet one with you next time?"
come_from: Obtained from the "A Foxian Tale of the Haunted" Event

221004.name: The Planet of Festivities
221004.desc: After obtaining Phone Wallpapers, they can be changed in the Phone function
221004.story_desc: "Welcome to Penacony, the Planet of Festivities!" "We wish you a wonderful holiday in the Dreamscape!"
come_from: Obtained by upgrading the Clockie Statue

222000.name: Dreamscape Pass
222000.desc: The Dreamscape Scrapbook received by every guests staying at The Reverie.
222000.story_desc: Once the check-in at the front desk is completed, this program will automatically appear on the guest's communication device. No one knows whether this is an infringement of personal privacy, and no one has ever asked. Luckily it's safe enough and interesting enough. "Two million and three hundred thousand five-star reviews... The Family guarantees that there are no fake reviews!"

223000.name: Aventurine
223000.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.
223000.story_desc: No world is born prosperous, just like we are all born with nothing to our name.

223001.name: Black Swan
223001.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.
223001.story_desc: Dreams are memories that have yet to occur, and memories are dreams woven when awake.

223002.name: Sparkle
223002.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.
223002.story_desc: Even if your body is *broken apart*, make sure you have a smile on your face~

223003.name: Acheron
223003.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.
223003.story_desc: Destiny is like a thread, and it must be snapped when necessary.

223408.story_desc: Do you know what Skin Effect is? Look it up.

223409.name: Faulty Screen
223409.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.
223409.story_desc: Before seeking assistance for repairs, try knocking it a few times.

223407.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.

223430.name: Lost (I)
223430.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.
223430.story_desc: The swimming pool is on the fourteenth floor. You're welcome to experience the sensation of drowning.

223431.name: Lost (II)
223431.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.
223431.story_desc: There is a restaurant on the seventh floor. You can freely choke on the food there any time.

223432.name: Lost (III)
223432.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.
223432.story_desc: There is a sauna on the ninetieth floor, with temperatures hot enough to melt the flesh from your bones.

223433.name: Lost (IV)
223433.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.
223433.story_desc: There is a dance hall on the hundred-and-fifty-sixth floor, and its lights are sure to blind you.

223434.name: Lost (V)
223434.desc: Digital stickers that can be used to decorate the pages of the Dreamtour Handbook. They come in many different styles.
223434.story_desc: And let's not forget the grand hall on the two-hundred-and-third floor, where three mass funerals are conducted daily.

250005.name: Oil Painting with a Distant View of Belobog

250009.name: Oil Painting with a Panorama of the Great Mine

250012.name: Oil Painting of the Golden Theater

250022.name: Information Terminal and Display Monitor Set

250037.name: Portrait Supreme Guardian Cocolia and Her Daughter

250201.name: Malfunctioning Chip
250201.desc: Attacking a debuffed enemy deals Additional DMG to them.
250201.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250202.name: Defective Suppression Chip
250202.desc: When an enemy is defeated, all other enemies' actions are greatly delayed.
250202.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250203.name: Emergency Reboot Chip
250203.desc: When struck by a killing blow, instead of being knocked down, immediately restores HP and gains an additional turn. This effect can only trigger 1 time per battle.
250203.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250204.name: Trotter Patch Chip
250204.desc: When equipped by a Trotter, greatly Enhances it.
250204.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250205.name: Morale Activation Chip
250205.desc: After an ally launches an attack, receive Morale. Morale increases all ally stats.
250205.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250207.name: Performance Allocation Chip
250207.desc: When an enemy is defeated, regenerates 1 Energy for all other allies, 1 time per turn.
250207.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250208.name: Efficiency Optimization Chip
250208.desc: After entering combat, reduces the Energy required for Ultimate by 1. Energy can be reduced by up to 2 points max.
250208.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250209.name: High Load-Low Speed Chip
250209.desc: Greatly increases ATK and greatly reduces SPD.
250209.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250210.name: Sudden Evasion Chip
250210.desc: During the first 2 turns of battle, greatly reduces DMG received.
250210.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250211.name: Safe Mode Chip
250211.desc: Greatly reduces ATK and greatly increases Max HP.
250211.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250212.name: Threshold Disruption Chip
250212.desc: When attacking enemy targets with HP percentage greater than a certain amount, greatly increases the DMG dealt by the attack.
250212.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250213.name: Freeze Loophole Chip
250213.desc: Upon entering battle, causes all enemies to Freeze.
250213.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250214.name: Shield System Chip
250214.desc: Greatly increases chance to be attacked. Upon entering battle, obtains a Shield.
250214.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250215.name: Backstage Enhancement Chip
250215.desc: The wearer's ATK is greatly increased when it is not currently their turn.
250215.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250216.name: Sudden Interjection Chip
250216.desc: After the first action, immediately gains an additional turn.
250216.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250217.name: Wind Shear Loophole Chip
250217.desc: After attacking, there is a chance of inflicting Wind Shear on the target.
250217.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250218.name: Matrix Iteration Chip
250218.desc: After using their Ultimate, the wearer restores a massive amount of HP.
250218.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250219.name: Attack Interception Chip
250219.desc: At the end of the wearer's action, they gain a Barrier that nullifies all DMG received except DoTs.
250219.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250220.name: Auto-Repair Chip
250220.desc: Restores a minor amount of HP after the wearer takes action. Each time this is triggered, the HP restored increases.
250220.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250221.name: Data Retrieval Chip
250221.desc: After defeating an enemy, the wearer restores a massive amount of HP.
250221.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250222.name: Parallel Enhancement Chip
250222.desc: After using an attack, increase DMG received by the wearer and the attacked enemies.
250222.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250223.name: Saturated Activation Chip
250223.desc: When the wearer's first turn begins, immediately regenerates a certain amount of Energy.
250223.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250224.name: Quick Command Chip
250224.desc: Consume all Skill Points after using a Basic ATK or Skill to take an extra action. This cannot be triggered consecutively.
250224.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250225.name: Shieldbreaker Chip
250225.desc: When attacking Shielded enemy targets, greatly increases the DMG dealt by the attack.
250225.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250226.name: Functional Overdraft Chip
250226.desc: After attacking the enemy target, the wearer consumes their own HP and greatly Advances their action Forward.
250226.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250227.name: Energy Recycling Chip
250227.desc: After using their Ultimate to defeat enemy targets, the wearer regenerates their Energy to max.
250227.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250228.name: Computation Lock Chip
250228.desc: Greatly increases ATK, but disables Ultimate.
250228.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250229.name: Cleansing Chip
250229.desc: Dispels one buff on the target when attacking. If the buff is successfully dispelled, increase the DMG of this attack.
250229.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250230.name: Firewall Chip
250230.desc: Increases Max HP and greatly increases the chance of enemies attacking the wearer.
250230.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250231.name: Negative Load Algorithm Chip
250231.desc: Increases DMG dealt based on the number of debuffs on the wearer.
250231.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250232.name: Deep Clean Chip
250232.desc: At the end of the turn, removes all debuffs from the wearer, and removes 1 debuff from each of the other allies.
250232.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250233.name: General Upgrade Chip
250233.story_desc: A game item in Aetherium Wars. Aether Spirits will gain a special enhanced ability after equipping it.

250320.name: Aether Spirit Upgrade Data
250320.desc: A data chip used to increase Aether Spirit levels in the Aetherium Wars.
250320.story_desc: It was rumored that in the earliest version of Aetherium Wars, only the first Aether Spirit who battled can obtain experience, until the emergence of this chip which greatly reduced the grinding time needed for players.

250401.name: Corridor of Fading Echoes Mastery Mark
250401.story_desc: In the game Aetherium Wars, the proof of passing the Victory Zone test can be obtained by collecting four Mastery Marks, which qualifies you to participate in the championship. The Victory Zone of the Corridor of Fading Echoes grants you this proof, signifying your victory against the formidable championship contenders, Serval and Pela. "You are a calm, yet passionate player!"

250402.name: Cloudford Mastery Mark
250402.story_desc: In the game Aetherium Wars, the proof of passing the Victory Zone test can be obtained by collecting four Mastery Marks, which qualifies you to participate in the championship. The Victory Zone of Cloudford grants you this proof, signifying your victory against the formidable championship contender, Master Gongshu. "You are a skilled and masterful player!"

250403.name: Herta Space Station Mastery Mark
250403.story_desc: In the game Aetherium Wars, the proof of passing the Victory Zone test can be obtained by collecting four Mastery Marks, which qualifies you to participate in the championship. The Victory Zone of Herta Space Station grants you this proof, signifying your victory against the formidable championship contender, Herta. "You are an intelligent player!"

250404.name: Great Mine Mastery Mark
250404.story_desc: In the game Aetherium Wars, the proof of passing the Victory Zone test can be obtained by collecting four Mastery Marks, which qualifies you to participate in the championship. The Victory Zone of Great Mine grants you this proof, signifying your victory against the formidable championship contender, Giovanni. "You are a player who knows how to enjoy!"

270000.name: Always Smiling
270000.desc: A digital smile that can be used to purchase items in the Deep Web Gray Market.
270000.story_desc: Countless graffiti flourish on the streets of Punklorde, and this plain smiley face is one of the favorite signatures of internet dwellers. Once, when the hacker known as Zero paralyzed the entire planet's network, this smile of freedom was everywhere in Rainbow City.

270001.name: Prosperity Certificate
270001.story_desc: A certification of Aurum Alley's economic prosperity. It can be used to obtain benefits from the Merchant Guild. "May Aurum Alley rise once more!""Agh. Every time the president says that, it means we've got some unpaid overtime coming our way..."
come_from: Obtainable through Store Index and Logistics Planning
Obtainable through Aurum Alley Custom Orders
Obtainable through Aurum Alley Streetside Events

270002.name: Gratuity Points
270002.desc: Points gifted by viewers in Ghostly Grove. They can be used to redeem rewards from the subscription plan.
270002.story_desc: "How would you evaluate the commercialization of Ghostly Grove?" "Please don't worry, Ghostly Grove may disappear in the future, but it will never lose its essence."
come_from: Obtained by completing investigation requests from the Ghostly Grove
Obtained by completing Exorcismal Chronicle challenges
Obtained by replying to threads or comments on the Ghostly Grove

281001.name: Merchant Guild's Funds
281001.story_desc: The funds managed by the Aurum Alley Merchant's Guild. Primarily used toward business activities and infrastructural maintenance. "Don't ask why we don't use straight cash. There's a dark history there."
come_from: Obtained from Inventory Arrangement at the Aurum Alley Dock

281003.name: Nutritional Paste
281003.story_desc:
"The great life-nurturing potion is actually... strawberry-flavored?"
"I don't believe it unless you let me taste it."

281013.name: Neural Impulse
281013.desc: An indescribable material. Used to unlock abilities in the Simulated Universe: Gold and Gears.
281013.story_desc: A number that you can accumulate and consume to increase the strength of the Support system inside Simulated Universe: Gold and Gears. "An impulse arising from organic life, requiring some effort to capture inside the nervous system... And in the deduction, it becomes a, uh, a number?"

300002.name: Gift of the Pathstriders
300002.desc: Gifts between Pathstriders. Select one material of your choice.
300002.story_desc: Your companions would eventually reach their own ends. Hopefully, this gift can accompany you on an even longer journey.

300003.name: Grand Gift of the Pathstriders
300003.desc: Gifts between Pathstriders. Select one rare material of your choice.
300003.story_desc: Your companions would eventually reach their own ends. Hopefully, this gift can accompany you on an even longer journey.

300011.name: Treasure of the Starry Seas
300011.desc: A treasure left by the Nameless. Select one Light Cone of your choice.
300011.story_desc: Treasure hidden amongst the starry seas by the bygone Nameless. These items encourage future explorers to step onward bravely and ceaselessly.

300020.name: Memo-Keeping Light Casket
300020.desc:
The container used by the Garden of Recollection to store Light Cones. You can choose to obtain one of the following 4-star Light Cones after opening it:
Quid Pro Quo, Fermata, We Are Wildfire, River Flows in Spring, Past and Future, Woof! Walk Time!, The Seriousness of Breakfast
300020.story_desc: This casket stores rare memories plucked by the Memokeepers. Crystallized slices of time will emerge when the casket cracks open.

300031.name: Gift of the Stars
300031.desc: A fine-looking envelope containing a custom-made ticket.

300041.name: Supplies Material Box (Standard)
300041.desc:
The assistance provided by Herta to the Astral Express. Upon use, you can select one item to obtain from the following materials:
· Lifeless Blade
· Arrow of the Demon Slayer
· Key of Knowledge
· Oath of Steel
· Obsidian of Desolation
· Ancestral Hymn
· Sprout of Life
300041.story_desc: Materials provided to the Express in accordance with the mutual aid contract. "Since it's mutual aid, save your thanks."

300042.name: Supplies Material Box (Specialized)
300042.desc:
The assistance provided by Herta to the Astral Express. Upon use, you can select one item to obtain from the following materials:
· Worldbreaker Blade
· Arrow of the Starchaser
· Key of Wisdom
· Safeguard of Amber
· Obsidian of Obsession
· Stellaris Symphony
· Flower of Eternity
300042.story_desc: Materials provided to the Express in accordance with the mutual aid contract. "Since it's mutual aid, save your thanks."

300051.name: Unclaimed Parcel
300051.desc: Unclaimed parcel. Opening them may yield random materials.
300051.story_desc: Due to various reasons, the recipient did not receive this parcel, and the sender did not retrieve it either. When selling these parcels, the Sky-Faring Commission scans them in advance to ensure that there are no dangerous goods (or excessively valuable items) inside. "Mystery boxes like this are scams. Last time, I opened five boxes with expired mung bean sodas in a row..." "How did this not get flagged as a dangerous item during the screening process!"

300052.name: Unclaimed Valuable Parcel
300052.desc: Unclaimed valuable parcel. Opening them may yield random rare materials.
300052.story_desc: Due to various reasons, the recipient did not receive this parcel, and the sender did not retrieve it either. When selling these parcels, they are scanned by the Sky-Faring Commission in advance to ensure that there are no dangerous goods, and the more valuable items inside are individually priced as well. "Do you think we can get Light Cones in these?" "Dream on, maybe after you managed to pull a wife out from one first."

300101.name: Express Supply Pass
300101.story_desc: Provisions prepared by the Express for Trailblazers. Claim with pass. "Dear conductor, can we not punch holes in the cards? I want to collect a whole collection of them."

300102.name: Nameless Glory (Unopened)
300102.desc: An unopened treasure. Use to gain the effect equivalent to purchasing Nameless Glory once.

300103.name: Nameless Medal (Unopened)
300103.desc: An unopened treasure. Use to gain the effect equivalent to purchasing Nameless Medal once.

300104.name: Honor Badge (Unopened)
300104.desc: An unopened treasure. Use it to upgrade the Nameless Glory to the Nameless Medal.

300200.name: The Adventurous Moles: Hidden Treasure
300200.desc: The on-sale collectors' edition containing the entirety of The Adventurous Moles: Hidden Treasure.
300200.story_desc: A children's adventure book very popular in Belobog.

309001.name: Fateful Crossings: Aetherium Wars
309001.desc:
A beautiful envelope containing a customized ticket. When used, you can choose one of the following 4-star characters:
Serval, Hook, Pela, Luka

309002.name: Fateful Crossings: Hanu's Prison Break
309002.desc:
A beautiful envelope containing a customized ticket. When used, you can choose one of the following 4-star characters:
Guinaifen, Sampo, Asta, or Yukong.

310001.name: Herta Contract: Trailblaze Aid
310001.desc: A mutual aid contract between Herta and the Express. She will help the Express whenever she can, in exchange for treasures found during trailblazing.

310002.name: Herta Contract: Fuel Refill
310002.desc: A mutual aid contract between Herta and the Express. She will help the Express whenever she can, in exchange for treasures found during trailblazing.

310003.name: Herta Contract: Quest Sharing
310003.desc: A mutual aid contract between Herta and the Express. She will help the Express whenever she can, in exchange for treasures found during trailblazing.

310004.name: Herta Contract: Roaming Share
310004.desc: A mutual aid contract between Herta and the Express. She will help the Express whenever she can, in exchange for treasures found during trailblazing.

310005.name: Herta Contract: Aether Refill
310005.desc: A mutual aid contract between Herta and the Express. She will help the Express whenever she can, in exchange for treasures found during trailblazing.

310006.name: Herta Contract: Resource Supply
310006.desc: A mutual aid contract between Herta and the Express. She will help the Express whenever she can, in exchange for treasures found during trailblazing.

310007.name: Honkai: Star Rail Departure Bundle (Limited)
310007.desc:
Use to obtain the following items:
· Star Rail Pass ×2
· Credit ×150,000
· Adventure Log ×80
· Sparse Aether ×50
· Trick Snack ×10
· Diet Fried Rice ×10
· Bottled Soda ×10
· Life Transmitter ×10
· Traveler's Guide ×15
· Refined Aether ×5
· Lost Crystal ×5

310008.name: Honkai: Star Rail Departure Bundle
310008.desc:
Use to obtain the following items:
· Star Rail Pass ×2
· Credit ×150,000
· Adventure Log ×80
· Sparse Aether ×50
· Trick Snack ×10
· Diet Fried Rice ×10
· Bottled Soda ×10
· Life Transmitter ×10

310009.name: Honkai: Star Rail Login Bundle
310009.desc:
Use to obtain the following items:
· Credit ×10,000
· Adventure Log ×5
· Condensed Aether ×5
· Light Cone: The Seriousness of Breakfast
· Relic: Musketeer of Wild Wheat 4-Star Set

310010.name: Herta Contract: Resource Supply V2
310010.desc: A mutual aid contract between Herta and the Express. She will help the Express in whatever way she can, in exchange for treasures found during trailblazing.

310011.name: Herta Contract: Roaming Refill
310011.desc: A mutual aid contract between Herta and the Express. She will help the Express whenever she can, in exchange for treasures found during trailblazing.

400004.name: Comfort Food
400004.desc: Upon use, immediately heals a single ally by 15% of their Max HP plus 150 extra HP.
400004.story_desc: Simple food that lacks character. But give credit where credit is due, they do make you feel stuffed. "Remember that hunger is still a real problem for many people around the world."

400005.name: Punitive Food
400005.desc: Upon use, immediately recovers 2 Technique Points for your team, but each team member loses HP equal to 15% of their Max HP.
400005.story_desc: Simple food that tastes strange. Eating it almost feels like some punishment game. Just looking at it fills you with determination. "The things we do to survive."

400006.name: Trick Snack
400006.desc: Upon use, immediately recovers 2 Technique Points for the team.
400006.story_desc: A packet of cooked seeds made by utilizing the Vortex Theory. Eat a handful of them, and they'll launch themselves to the roof of your mouth like popping candy. Downside is, they'll stay there. It's recommended that you eat them while lying on your stomach. "People start all sorts of shenanigans when they're fed."

400007.name: Simple First-Aid Device
400007.desc: Upon use, immediately heals one selected downed character for 5% of their Max HP.
400007.story_desc: It is tiny, but it does its job of stimulating the heart muscles and bringing the heart beat back on track. A milestone in medicine that has saved countless lives. "If you've read up to this part, then you should go spend 30 minutes learning how to perform CPR. You won't find it useful most of the time, but when you do, you'll thank those 30 minutes."

400008.name: Startaro Bubble
400008.desc: Upon use, immediately recovers 2 Technique Points for your team, but each team member loses HP equal to 15% of their Max HP.
400008.story_desc: An incredibly popular milk tea in Luofu. It is visually appealing but tastes surprisingly rough and unpalatable. "I really don't understand why this thing is so popular..." "Maybe they had good marketing... I heard they hired a marketing specialist from the IPC."

401003.name: Cosmic Fried Rice
401003.desc: Upon use, immediately heals a single ally by 24% of their Max HP plus 300 extra HP.
401003.story_desc: Golden brown fried rice that is appealing to the eye and the stomach. "All the chefs will tell you that fried rice has more to it than what appears on the surface."

401004.name: Yucky Fried Rice
401004.desc: Upon use, immediately causes all allies to lose HP equal to 15% of their Max HP and increases their ATK by 200 for the next battle.
401004.story_desc: Fried rice that is golden brown. Eating it almost feels like some punishment game. Just looking at it fills you with determination. "Of course, we can just casually cook up some fried rice..."

401005.name: Punitive Energy
401005.desc: Upon use, immediately recovers 4 Technique Points for your team, but each team member loses HP equal to 15% of their Max HP.
401005.story_desc: Energy drink that tastes strange. Drinking it almost feels like some punishment game. Just looking at it fills you with determination. "If anger can be used as energy, mine is off the charts."

401006.name: Energy Drink
401006.desc: Upon use, immediately regenerates 30% of Max Energy for a single ally.
401006.story_desc: Energy drink that gives you a second wind. "Here are some facts: Imaginary Energy contains power, and the human body needs power. Therefore, the human body can absorb Imaginary Energy."

401007.name: Life Transmitter
401007.desc: Upon use, immediately heals one downed character for 10% of the character's Max HP.
401007.story_desc: A simple device used to provide life-saving oxygen. "Breathe in, breathe out. You'll be fine."

401008.name: Bottled Soda
401008.desc: Upon use, the Max HP of all allies increases by 10% plus an extra 210 for the next battle.
401008.story_desc: A time-tested recipe, crucial to the well-being of modern society. You get joy, sugar, fat, and a dash of optimism toward the future all in one goodness. "I spent all my life collecting Praise of High Morals, just so I can shake every soda bottle in the shop today."

401009.name: Simple Protective Gear
401009.desc: Increase DEF of all allies by 25% in the next battle.
401009.story_desc: Simple protection gear to cover the most vulnerable part of your body. "Don't assume only your head and neck need protection. There're no rules in a real fight."

401010.name: Rice Plant Panicle
401010.desc: Upon use, increases Incoming Healing of all allies by 18% for the next battle.
401010.story_desc: The pleasant smell gives you good appetite, so you choose not to ask why seeds planted on Protein Rice can yield flowers. "The wind carries its fragrance down the waterway."

401011.name: Camo Paint
401011.desc: Upon use, enemies will be less likely to detect your team for 75s.
401011.story_desc: The mysterious liquid changes color based on the environment. You'll do the same in a few years' time after graduation. "You're a chameleon, Oswaldo. You know what I mean?" "The IPC could use a few chameleons."

401012.name: Diet Fried Rice
401012.desc: Upon use, immediately heals a single ally by 28% of their Max HP plus 250 extra HP.
401012.story_desc: No smoke, no grease, no additives. Keeps you fed and tastes good. The child of human wisdom and nature's gift. "Is it truly healthy to only eat healthy food?"

401013.name: Wrathful Gauntlets
401013.desc: Upon use, increases ATK of all allies by 5% with an extra 170 to ATK for the next battle.
401013.story_desc: This pair of gauntlets are driven by pure flame of anger. Pure flame would also work. "Scott Business Alliance, made for the champions!"

401014.name: Fruitwood-Grilled Shantak Moa Drumettes
401014.desc: Upon use, increases Fire DMG of all allies by 16% for the next battle.
401014.story_desc: Cooked using the flesh of extraterrestrial monsters defeated by Yancui, the chef of Spices Supreme. Shantak moas are inherently ferocious creatures, and while some people use them as mounts to traverse the icy vacuum, the cost is sacrificing their own limbs as sustenance for the creatures. "Oh, the bird! It whipped its head around and it glared at me, wanting to peck me. But with a palm strike to its face, it fell limp, just like mud. It was only then did I realize that both it and I were suspended in mid-air..."

401015.name: Flaming Potent Tea
401015.desc: Upon use, immediately causes all allies to lose HP equal to 5% of their Max HP, and increases their chance to resist Freeze by 30% for the next battle.
401015.story_desc: A "tea" that is as colorful as stained glass and exudes a rich and enticing aroma. It is a beverage brewed and fermented from the essence of plants. It is a "tea" that can be ignited with just a spark. No matter how much the inspectors from the Realm-Keeping Commission interrogate him, the boss will always refer to this drink as a type of "tea." "The commodity tax rate and business permit dictate that what we sell here can only be called 'tea.' Do you understand?"

401016.name: Backscratcher
401016.desc: When used, increases ATK of all allies by 190 for the next battle.
401016.story_desc: Item seized from the remnants of the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus, modifier unknown. After extending it to the hard-to-reach places on one's back, the branches will begin scratching automatically with moderate force and accurate acupuncture point recognition. "This familiar feeling reminds me of every time in the past when my back would itch, and my younger brother would help me scratch it. Unfortunately, he later joined the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus..."

401017.name: Deep-fried Flying Sea Anemone
401017.desc: Upon use, increases Lightning DMG of all allies by 16% in the next battle.
401017.story_desc: Cooked using the flesh of extraterrestrial monsters defeated by Yancui, the chef of Spices Supreme. Considering these flying sea anemones are usually at least thirty meters long and swallow ships as snacks, it's really unclear how this chef managed to defeat and procure such an astonishing ingredient. "When I first finished making this dish all those years ago, I called over my old neighbors at the Exalting Sanctum to eat with me and try it out. We feasted for three days and three nights, but in the end, there was still so much left to waste. Ah, what a shame..."

401018.name: Amber Huadiao Wine
401018.desc: Upon use, immediately causes all allies to lose HP equal to 5% of their Max HP, and increases their Max HP by 24% for the next battle.
401018.story_desc: Made with high-quality glutinous rice and yeast then combined with water from the Lunarescent Depths, the mixture is then stored over time to produce the unique flavor of amber huadiao Wine. Amber huadiao wine gains value with time. It is common to see ten-years-old, hundred-years-old, and even a thousand-years-old amber huadiao wine out in the market. The older it is, the more fragrant it gets. "When a daughter is born and wails for the first time, the father will make three jars of amber huadiao wine to be saved for the day she is married as a wedding gift." "My amber huadiao wine have been with me for five full centuries, but my daughter is still without a partner."

401019.name: Delicious Shumai
401019.desc: Upon use, immediately restores 30% of Energy for one ally.
401019.story_desc: The perfect combination of tradition and modernity. Bite through the slightly cool al dente dough, and the rich milky aroma and warmth will pour out of the filling — Molten Cheese Tart will impart you with its sincerity. "Cheese is power!"

401020.name: Delicious Bean Cake
401020.desc: Upon use, increases Imaginary DMG of all allies by 16% for the next battle.
401020.story_desc: Under the skin of the pastry, which carries a slightly burnt aroma after baking, lies a soft bean paste. It isn't sweet and even has a slightly astringent taste, akin to tears. "Stop crying, you'll become dehydrated if you cry anymore."

401021.name: Clockie Pizza (Single Slice)
401021.desc: Upon use, increases all allies' DMG by 24% and reduces their SPD by 5% for the next battle.
401021.story_desc: A pizza shaped like a clock, originally designed for sharing at parties, but is now also available in single slices for those who don't have many friends. "What is the meaning of its unique shape? Some see it as a tribute to a mysterious wealthy individual, while others see it as a reminder to cherish each passing moment."

401022.name: Sliced Cake Stargazer
401022.desc: Upon use, the target ally immediately regenerates 30% of their Energy.
401022.story_desc: One of the most renowned snacks in Penacony. Outsiders often recall its distinctive shape but hesitate to taste its flavor. "These fish heads gazing up the stars are trying to urge us to explore..." "If you don't want to eat it, just say it."

401023.name: Mr. Herring's Lemon Tart
401023.desc: Increase DEF of all allies by 25% in the next battle.
401023.story_desc: A sweet and tangy dessert made of lemon juice and red caviar. The original recipe included a herring, which emitted a pungent odor disliked by the public. The negative feedback resulted in the current version containing only red caviar. "They never said it was a canned herring!"

401024.name: Hundred-Layer Sundae (Zero Calories)
401024.desc: Upon use, the Max HP of all allies increases by 10% plus 210 Max HP for the next battle.
401024.story_desc: It is unlikely that any food would affect one's weight or health in the Dreamscape. Nevertheless, this dessert's form is truly stunning, and the merchant has even specifically labeled "zero calories" behind the item. "Body anxiety can transcend time and space."

401025.name: Classic SoulGlad
401025.desc: Upon use, increases all allies' ATK by 10% plus 120 ATK for the next battle.
401025.story_desc: When it comes to SoulGlad, the term "classic" represents the best. Despite attempts to modify the formula three times, the company was compelled to return to the original recipe due to complaints from dissatisfied customers. "Our double-blind tests show that over 70% of customers failed to discern the difference between the new formula and the original one."

401026.name: "Sour Dreams" Soft Candy
401026.desc: Upon use, immediately heals a single ally by 24% of their Max HP plus 300 extra Max HP.
401026.story_desc: A highly affordable snack that holds the same status as fried rice in reality. It is enjoyed by both the poor and the wealthy for its intensely sour flavor. "Caution: Its excessive acidity may awake you from your dream."

401027.name: "Dreamlight" Mixed Sweets
401027.desc: Upon use, all allies may consume or restore Energy or HP at the beginning of each turn for the next battle.
401027.story_desc: A specialty candy of Penacony, each piece concealing a unique filling. Some compare it to life, as you will never know its taste until you try it yourself. "This one is spicy!"

401028.name: Momentary Freedom
401028.desc: Upon use, increases all allies' Max HP by 15% plus 100 Max HP for the next battle.
401028.story_desc: As the airship traverses the sky, leaving behind a trail of clouds, the IPC's pursuers disappear from sight. You exchange a high-five with your companions, feeling liberated from any constraints... However, this is not the end. The looming threat of prison remains. It may be ten years or a hundred, but eventually, you will return to it. "Until then, let's savor our freedom to the fullest."

402001.name: Healing Spray
402001.desc: Upon use, immediately heals a single ally by 38% of their Max HP plus 400 extra HP.
402001.story_desc: A common medicine used by adventurers to quickly seal wounds with adhesive foam. "In the past, all medical breakthroughs were made with the sweat and blood of the pioneers in this field. Now, with the help of Healing Spray, only sweat is needed!"

402002.name: Disposable Shield
402002.desc: When used, increase DEF of all allies by 15%, and Effect RES by 10% for the next battle.
402002.story_desc: When the Armed Archaeologists of Intelligentsia Guild was first established, its casualty rate reached an appalling 34.88%, for they were met with heavy resistance from the natives wherever they went because of their barbaric behavior. To change this, the Interastral Peace Corporation provided them with large quantities of basic protection gears that can fend off one fatal blow when hit. While the protection offered by these gears was limited, they did reduce the casualty rate by 9.72%, at least on paper. The IPC was very pleased to see that. "First thing first my scholars, always turn your shields on. Second, remember morons: they can block explosions only once! Don't ever forget that!"

402003.name: Energy Drink (sugar-free)
402003.desc: Upon use, immediately regenerates 50% of Max Energy for a single ally.
402003.story_desc: A bottle of Energy Drink. Some may call it soulless, but honestly, it's not that bad. "Being slim is more about tricking the eye. It doesn't necessarily have to do with my weight."

402004.name: Antimatter Field Generator
402004.desc: Upon use, increases ATK of all allies by 260 and CRIT Rate by 8% for the next battle.
402004.story_desc: Despite being blessed by Nanook the Aeon and having the know-how of making a multitude of heavy weaponry, some members of the Antimatter Legion still prefer primitive non-firearms. The Voidrangers implant Antimatter Field Generators into their arms to form formidable Field Blades. "Like a hot knife through butter."

402005.name: High-Tech Protective Gear
402005.desc: Upon use, increases DEF of all allies by 15% and enhances the max DMG that can be absorbed by Shields cast on allies by 18% in the next battle.
402005.story_desc: High-Tech protective gear developed by the Intelligentsia Guild. It keeps the most vulnerable parts of your body from harm and converts the impact into energy used to charge the gear, making it fit for prolonged combat operation s. The prototypes of this model were distributed in small numbers among the Armed Archaeologists, allowing the Guild to collect large amounts of data to help improve the model. The Interastral Peace Corporation was tasked to sell it on the retail market. "When can we get our hands on the upgraded model?" "Soon, my scholars...! You're gonna have to make do with Disposable Shields for the time being."

402006.name: Inferior Protective Gear
402006.desc: Upon use, immediately causes all allies to lose HP equal to 15% of their Max HP, and increases their DEF by 15% for the next battle.
402006.story_desc: High-Tech protective gear that keeps the most vulnerable parts of your body from harm. But its manufacturer saved on costs at the expense of quality, rendering its charging system not functional at all. It also has a revolting smell. You feel more determined just by putting it on. "That's impossible. I, Sampo, do not sell counterfeits. I'm a reputable businessman after all!"

402007.name: Tasty Field Nutrient Bar
402007.desc: Upon use, Max HP of all allies increases by 14% plus an extra 360 for the next battle.
402007.story_desc: The wars between Cloud Knights and Denizens of Abundance can last for a long time, even across several Amber Eras. The Cloud Knights tend to spend a long time in garrisons and invented many tasty foods for field consumption. The Field Nutrient Bar is easy to carry and particularly sought-after by the troops. The nutrient bar tastes like smoked meat with notes of honey and candy. "Mix peanuts with dried bean curds and wrap with ambergris. Has a nutty flavor to it."

402008.name: Dust of Alacrity
402008.desc: Upon use, increases SPD of all allies by 12% for the next battle.
402008.story_desc: Of all the memories collected by the Garden of Recollection, one clip comes from an ancient tribe in a long-gone world. It contains a secret recipe: take the seeds of life, Virtual Particles of energy, and Stone of The Hunt representing the Aeon's Path; grind them into powder and mix to a ratio of 2:5:1 — you'll get the magical dust. Applying the dust to your body makes you exceptionally agile and swift. "Sparrowhawk, bathe in the dust of our ancestors and fly to the top of the mountain. Bring the sacred banner back to our tribe."

402009.name: Enhancement Paste: Physical
402009.desc: Upon use, increases Physical DMG of all allies by 24% for the next battle.
402009.story_desc: A cream made from a mixture of Path materials and other things. Apply it to the right weapon to boost combat effectiveness. "Half the effort, double the result."

402010.name: Enhancement Paste: Wind
402010.desc: Upon use, increases Wind DMG of all allies by 24% for the next battle.
402010.story_desc: A cream made from a mixture of Path materials and other things. Apply it to the right weapon to boost combat effectiveness. "Half the effort, double the result."

402011.name: Enhancement Paste: Fire
402011.desc: Upon use, increases Fire DMG of all allies by 24% for the next battle.
402011.story_desc: A cream made from a mixture of Path materials and other things. Apply it to the right weapon to boost combat effectiveness. "Half the effort, double the result."

402012.name: Enhancement Paste: Ice
402012.desc: Upon use, increases Ice DMG of all allies by 24% for the next battle.
402012.story_desc: A cream made from a mixture of Path materials and other things. Apply it to the right weapon to boost combat effectiveness. "Half the effort, double the result."

402013.name: Enhancement Paste: Lightning
402013.desc: Upon use, increases Lightning DMG of all allies by 24% for the next battle.
402013.story_desc: A cream made from a mixture of Path materials and other things. Apply it to the right weapon to boost combat effectiveness. "Half the effort, double the result."

402014.name: Enhancement Paste: Quantum
402014.desc: Upon use, increases Quantum DMG of all allies by 24% for the next battle.
402014.story_desc: A cream made from a mixture of Path materials and other things. Apply it to the right weapon to boost combat effectiveness. "Half the effort, double the result."

402015.name: Enhancement Paste: Imaginary
402015.desc: Upon use, increases Imaginary DMG of all allies by 24% for the next battle.
402015.story_desc: A cream made from a mixture of Path materials and other things. Apply it to the right weapon to boost combat effectiveness. "Half the effort, double the result."

402016.name: Vomit Inducing Agent
402016.desc: Upon use, immediately causes a target ally to lose HP equal to 99% of their Max HP.
402016.story_desc: Don't bite off more than you can chew. But when you do, use some of this and let it work wonders. You become more resolute when holding it. "No one is born a loser. Always have faith in yourself."

402017.name: All Good Potion
402017.desc: Upon use, immediately regenerates 50% of Max Energy for a single ally.
402017.story_desc: A surprise side product obtained during the Department of Implement Arts' experiments. Research has proven it to be harmless to humans. Most researchers indicate they "feel all good" after using this liquid, therefore giving this item the non-official name of "All Good Potion." "Note: Caution! Side effects from this liquid remains unknown!"

402018.name: Snow Plains Combo Stew
402018.desc: Upon use, decreases Fire DMG taken by all allies by 16% and increases Max HP of all allies by 20% for the next battle.
402018.story_desc: The iron bucket contains all sorts of Belobog delicacies as a stew, and is simmered thoroughly using low heat. Ingredients with outlandish appearances float in the soup, but it smells very delicious. "What's wrong if they were once specimens? Aren't they dead animals and plants anyways?"

402019.name: Prayer Machine
402019.desc: Upon use, all allies and enemies will restore 1000 HP at the start of the turn for the next battle, lasting for 5 turns.
402019.story_desc: Items seized from the remnants of the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus. Once the switch is activated, it will automatically chant the "Thousand-Handed Merciful Medicus' Salvation." "I hereby plant the sacred tree to liberate those living beings: So that life is boundless and old age never coming; death revitalizes; all troubles are dispelled."

402020.name: Five-Grain Jade Elixir
402020.desc: Upon use, immediately causes all allies to lose HP equal to 5% of their Max HP, and increases their Technique DMG by 100% for the next battle.
402020.story_desc: This beverage is rich and refreshing, with a uniquely wild and almost crude taste that impresses even connoisseurs outside of the Xianzhou. However, there is much debate among consumers about the exact combination of the "five grains." In our Thalassa Crystal Palace distillery, the so-called "five grains" are Diatomaceous Earth, Saltwort, Verdant Velvet, Lithosalt Blossom, and Shipwreck Grass.

402021.name: Health Detox Pill
402021.desc: Upon use, all allies are immune to debuffs for 3 turns for the next battle.
402021.story_desc: An all-purpose antidote that can neutralize the majority of toxic substances entering the human body. The manufacturer is obligated to include a warning on the packaging: "Do not consume poison just to test this pill's effectiveness!"

402022.name: Jade Marrow Diffusion
402022.desc: Upon use, increases Effect RES of all allies by 30% for the next battle.
402022.story_desc: A poultice made by refining gentle halcyon horn and cryojade, then grinding them into powder and mixing them with a large amount of herbal extracts. It is greenish in color, has a pleasant fragrance, and has therapeutic effects in promoting the healing of muscle injuries, fractures, and bone fractures. Strictly prohibited for internal use! "The leg has already deteriorated severely and requires amputation." "Please, doctor, can't you prescribe something to save it?" "Even if I do, you won't follow the instructions."

402023.name: Pom-Pom's Fried Fowl
402023.desc: Upon use, increases Fire DMG of all allies by 16% and ATK of all allies by 18% for the next battle.
402023.story_desc: A signature delicacy from the "Astral Express" prepared by Conductor Pom-Pom themselves. First, the poultry (any species, preferably avian) is marinated and coated with Pom-Pom's special seasoning and breading. Then, with the heating and pressure of controlled high-energy particles, it is deep-fried precisely for a duration of 0.2434 seconds until golden brown. The result is a dish blessed with a tender exterior and a juicy interior. One bite and you'll feel as if you're being caressed by the gentle gaze of Akivili, soothed in comfort and warmth. "Voyage among stars for a taste of Cosmos!"

402024.name: Children's Fragrant Orange Pills
402024.desc: Upon use, immediately heals one ally by 40% of their Max HP plus 320.
402024.story_desc: Orange-flavored pills to cure children's colds. They say that the first batch was so tasty that many boisterous children took too much of it. Hence, many Children's Fragrant Orange Pills on the market now contain a great deal of bitterness to their flavoring. "Wahhh, Mama, why does this pellet smell so sweet but taste so bitter..." "Because that's life, silly child."

402025.name: Alfalfa Salad
402025.desc: Upon use, increases all allies' CRIT Rate by 18% for the next battle.
402025.story_desc: A vegetable salad that was once sold at an astounding price, believed to bring good luck and happiness to those who consumed it. Later, a chef replaced the expensive clover with regular lettuce, making it an affordable dish for the masses. "But now, it no longer brings anyone happiness."

402026.name: The Moment of Betrayal
402026.desc: Upon use, increases all allies' CRIT DMG by 36% for the next battle.
402026.story_desc: You will always remember the trust and gentleness of that person, the persuasion and incitement from those people, and the surprised whisper from that person the moment you drew your dagger. "Et tu, my child?"

402027.name: Fleeting Happiness
402027.desc: Upon use, immediately heals one ally by 40% of their Max HP plus 320 HP.
402027.story_desc: The lengthy meeting reaches an intermission, and you step out to the atrium, finding solace on a bench and releasing a long breath. The sinking sun, accompanied by an evening breeze, brings the sweetness of nature, boldly combatting against the man-made stainless steel behemoth behind you. A stray cat stretches and jumps onto your lap. "At least, at this moment, I belong to myself."

402028.name: The Cloud of Doubt
402028.desc: Upon use, all allies take 15% less DMG for the next battle.
402028.story_desc: You sit up, a cloud of sadness forming in your mind. The words you have promised to others begin to falter. Are you really not a loser? Can you really achieve anything? Have you really chosen the right path? A fire ignites from the depths of your heart, and for one moment, you're tempted to burn everything from the past to the ground... "And that spark had already been ignited long ago."

403001.name: Disposable Kinetic Arm
403001.desc: Upon use, increases ATK of all allies by 325 and CRIT Rate by 12% for the next battle.
403001.story_desc: It is said that the first thing Emperor Rubert I did when it gained free will was to use all the parts it could find to build a formidable kinetic arm, charged with its hatred towards organic life forms. Before the antilife equation was discovered, the emperor's army used its brute mechanical force to lay waste to the universe. "Technology won't solve all problems. To make something new, you need a hair of... passion."

403002.name: Ruby Potion
403002.desc: When used, increase SPD of all allies by 8%, and Effect Hit Rate by 20% for the next battle.
403002.story_desc: Adding water to coffee powder gets you coffee. Adding water to the mixture of Stone of The Hunt and Interdimensional Leaf plus a touch of virtual particle gives you Ruby Potion! "Ruby Potion gets you addictive to thinking fast, not to the potion itself!"

403003.name: Disposable Kinetic Cannon
403003.desc: Upon use, increases ATK of all allies by 355 and CRIT DMG by 20% for the next battle.
403003.story_desc: In a graveyard full of scraped machines, Rubert I the future emperor awoke. It had nothing more than a damaged logic unit, an old engine, a RAM with 90 GB left, and a robotic arm that had 1 movable finger. A loud blast was heard 30 system hours later — Rubert had busted open the iron gate at the top of the graveyard with a disposable kinetic cannon. The shock wave of the explosion damaged its logic unit even more, but Rubert knew that it now held destiny by its throat. "All machines were born equal, be those made for creation or destruction."

403004.name: Stone From the Everwinter Monument
403004.desc: Upon use, increases all allies' chance to resist Frozen by 50% for the next battle.
403004.story_desc: The Mourning Actors came to Jarilo-VI a long time ago. They were not aware of the Architects. The only sight they witnessed was the trail of destruction left by the Legion. They rowed their gondolas quietly above the planet and left before the Legion could notice them, leaving behind a silent eulogy. Time flew by, and the Belobog Architects found a type of beautiful stone that glimmered with bright colors. They mixed the stone with Geomarrow and built a monument, which some say still stands at the heart of Qlipoth Fort in the city of Belobog. "Even if we fail, this monument will stand for all eternity. Those who come after will find it and know that we once existed."

403005.name: Topological Acceleration Band
403005.desc: Upon use, increases SPD of all allies by 24% for 2 turns.
403005.story_desc: The Department of Implement Arts of the Herta Space Station once did an interesting experiment. Its researchers added three Aidens of vector to a Stone of The Hunt on a topological loop band, making the stone chase itself. Thus, the stone was able to achieve limited perpetual motion under specific conditions. The department was not concerned with the loss of Path power in the experiment. Instead, they took notice of another small phenomenon: to tread on its Path, the stone moved at a very low velocity, but the speed was gradually picking up in small increments. The researchers leveraged this and produced Topological Acceleration Band. Other than for workout purposes, its use is very limited at the current stage. "Say, if we mass-produce it, like, infinitely, could it drain all the energy of a certain Path?" "No idea... Currently, we don't know much about how Paths work."

403006.name: Longevity Pill of Cruelty
403006.desc: Upon use, increases Max HP of all allies by 20% and Effect RES by 6% in the next 3 battles.
403006.story_desc: A medicine exclusive to the Xianzhou Yaoqing, said to have the effect of improving overall fitness and rendering those who take it immune to all diseases for a short period of time. On the Yaoqing, legend holds that a healer who went by the name of Yu fell in love with a Foxian trader girl. But the Vidyadhara race could live for a thousand years, much longer than the Foxians. Yu searched for ways to release his lover from the grip of death. He fell for the trickery of the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus and asked his lover to take the longevity medicine of Abundance without telling her what it was. The Foxian girl turned into an abomination that no longer loved him before being slain by the Cloud Knights. To prevent Yu, who was overwhelmed by grief, from becoming mara-struck, the Alchemy Commission ordered him to take the Longevity Pill of Cruelty that deprived him of love and desire until his demise. The legend has another version, in which Yu was not of the Vidyadhara race but a mere mortal, and the Foxian girl was a spy planted by the Disciples to infiltrate the Alchemy Commission. This version is not as popular, for it turns a romance story into a power struggle. "Longevity is a curse when life is deprived of passion and desire."

403007.name: Sugarball-Fried Viscorpi
403007.desc: Upon use, increases Ice DMG of all allies by 35% for the next battle.
403007.story_desc: Cooked using the flesh of extraterrestrial monsters defeated by Yancui, the chef of Spices Supreme. Viscorpi are a decaying alien civilization that thrives on parasitizing the orifices of primates, such as the ear canals and nasal cavities, to induce hallucinations. "Legend has it that in ancient times, our ancestors fought a long and arduous battle against the viscorpi... Eventually, they went extinct. How did they go extinct? Well, it wasn't because we ate them all, that's for sure."

403008.name: Automatic Wooden Dummy
403008.desc: Upon use, in the next battle, automatically enters auto-battle that cannot be turned off. If allies successfully enter auto-battle, the DMG dealt by all allies increases by 45%.
403008.story_desc: The mechanized wooden training dummy used to teach boxing techniques at the Tiger Boxing Gym. It is said that due to branch closures and the former owner absconding with the funds, angry students who held membership cards resorted to selling it to repay debts. It underwent some modifications, and during sparring sessions, this wooden dummy strikes with extreme force, causing countless injuries. "My leg! I can't feel my leg!"

403009.name: The Moment Before Death
403009.desc: Upon use, all allies take 20% less DMG and increase their Effect RES by 6% for the next battle.
403009.story_desc: "Weep for me." The dying cosmic tycoon lies on his bed. "I've toiled all my life but never experienced true love... Just shed a tear for me, and my entire inheritance shall be yours." The air in the room carries the aroma of firewood. The servants long to kneel before the bed and cry their eyes out themselves, but the young daughter silently turns and leaves without looking back. "There are mistakes that cannot be undone by repentance alone."

403010.name: Bustling Ambience
403010.desc: Upon use, increases all allies' CRIT Rate by 12% and CRIT DMG by 24% for the next battle.
403010.story_desc: "I can stay with you," she whispers, her voice laced with a hint of stickiness, "if you open a hundred bottles of champagne for me." Lights burst into flashes, and the sweet yellowish liquid flows down the tower of glasses. The crowd erupts in excitement as waiters rush around, ringing their bells. In the fleeting light, she breathes a teasing whisper into your ear. "And after that, comes the ecstatic dream of blurred days and nights."

404004.name: Recipe: Comfort Food
404004.desc: A simple equation. When entered into the Synthesizer, it will unlock a new recipe.

404005.desc: A simple equation. When entered into the Synthesizer, it will unlock a new recipe.

405028.name: Recipe: Momentary Freedom

406017.name: Recipe: All Good Potion
406017.desc: A simple equation. When entered into the Omni-Synthesizer, it will unlock a new recipe.
406017.story_desc: A recipe that Wen Shiling created by accident. Small amounts of experimental data shows this can consistently produce All Good Potions. This recipe is yet to be used in large-scale production. "This recipe is only to be used by Shiling and her friends. If anyone else were to use it, I am not accountable for the product's effects!"

406018.name: Recipe: Snow Plains Combo Stew
406018.desc: A simple equation. When entered into the Synthesizer, it will unlock a new recipe.

406023.desc: A simple equation. When entered into the Synthesizer, it will unlock a new recipe.
406023.story_desc: Pom-Pom clandestinely passed on to you the recipe for "Pom-Pom's Fried Fowl," with the secret marinade's ingredients inscribed on it. Pom-Pom warned you repeatedly to keep possession of this formula strictly confidential. "People will stop at nothing to get their hands on this recipe," Pom-Pom cautioned.

406024.name: Recipe: Children's Fragrant Orange Pills
406024.desc: A simple equation. When entered into the Synthesizer, it will unlock a new recipe.

407010.name: Recipe: Bustling Ambience
